commit_message:
Enable Tempest without devstack

To be able to use the functional tests outside of devstack, this
adds a configurtion option to bypass the service catalog and disables
checking SSL certificates during testing.

Change-Id: I56d7403e268074ddb167f6ae8dac8b86b77eb1aa
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-tempest

subject: Convert project to os-testr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-03 13:09:36.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Convert project to os-testr

I am not sure how folks feel about this, but I think os-testr
makes failures a little easier to debug when tests fail.  For
one thing you get stdout/stderr in the test output.  Running a
single test is a little different:

    tox -e py27 -- --regex keystoneauth1.tests.unit.identity.test_token

Change-Id: Iea05633af3708c5e9443d86c8ddf947e68c0bebe
'}]
commit_message:
Convert project to os-testr

I am not sure how folks feel about this, but I think os-testr
makes failures a little easier to debug when tests fail.  For
one thing you get stdout/stderr in the test output.  Running a
single test is a little different:

    tox -e py27 -- --regex keystoneauth1.tests.unit.identity.test_token

Change-Id: Iea05633af3708c5e9443d86c8ddf947e68c0bebe

commit_message:
Move Disk allocation ratio to ResourceTracker

We already moved the CPU and RAM ratios to the compute nodes in Liberty
but we forgot to add the disk one. Adding it now.

That change specifically implies that nova.conf is consistent across the whole
cloud since what was formerly defined on the scheduler side will have its
definition by the compute nodes.

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: Ic6ad677d6fff4d06b5b433d6ede67ad511754995
Partially-Implements: blueprint disk-allocation-ratio-to-rt

subject: Update bashate lint checks re: E005, E006, E040
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-09 09:30:03.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-docs/scripts.rst', 'playbooks/roles/os_neutron/templates/plugins/plumgrid/pgrc', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Update bashate lint checks re: E005, E006, E040

Backport note:
This patch merges three related patches.

Patch 1: Resolve bashate violation E005

This patch implements changes required to resolve bashate violation
E005 and also improves the tox config to improve the search for
bash scripts in the repository.

(cherry picked from commit 360b44c6cec8fc956adf92bc28c3a1bf01f1247f)

Patch 2: Add notes about bashate E006 exception

bashate tests fail with 'E006: Line longer than 79 columns'.

As many scripts are deployed as templates and use jinja templating,
this rule is very difficult to achieve. It is still considered a
preference and should be a goal to improve readability, within reason.

Validation of this reasoning will be up to the human reviewers instead
of being forced by the lint tests.

(cherry picked from commit b9eb3699dee6a58d02348de0d5a8f903ed765ce7)

Patch 3: Add bashate E040 exception

As many scripts are deployed as templates and use use jinja templating,
this will often fail. This test is reasonably safely ignored as the
syntax error will be identified when executing the resulting script.

(cherry picked from commit 03db583b6e59fe0bb000f7d28cfd65e96d208ca3)

Change-Id: I4531126b850d54dc06e29bd9b5cf21fbff87bfd3
"}]
commit_message:
Update bashate lint checks re: E005, E006, E040

Backport note:
This patch merges three related patches.

Patch 1: Resolve bashate violation E005

This patch implements changes required to resolve bashate violation
E005 and also improves the tox config to improve the search for
bash scripts in the repository.

(cherry picked from commit 360b44c6cec8fc956adf92bc28c3a1bf01f1247f)

Patch 2: Add notes about bashate E006 exception

bashate tests fail with 'E006: Line longer than 79 columns'.

As many scripts are deployed as templates and use jinja templating,
this rule is very difficult to achieve. It is still considered a
preference and should be a goal to improve readability, within reason.

Validation of this reasoning will be up to the human reviewers instead
of being forced by the lint tests.

(cherry picked from commit b9eb3699dee6a58d02348de0d5a8f903ed765ce7)

Patch 3: Add bashate E040 exception

As many scripts are deployed as templates and use use jinja templating,
this will often fail. This test is reasonably safely ignored as the
syntax error will be identified when executing the resulting script.

(cherry picked from commit 03db583b6e59fe0bb000f7d28cfd65e96d208ca3)

Change-Id: I4531126b850d54dc06e29bd9b5cf21fbff87bfd3

commit_message:
Ability to turn off client search for full text search

Allow setting of an attribute to turn off client
side full text search when configured.

Specify client-full-text-search="false" for hz-magic-search-bar

Change-Id: I058b7a3a61d1ec606f80e261c5a4878f45f61ea6
Partial-Bug: #1496627

subject: Fix L3 HA with IPv6
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6579, 'name': 'Nir Magnezi', 'email': 'nmagnezi@redhat.com', 'username': 'nmagnezi'}, {'_account_id': 6876, 'name': 'stephen-ma', 'email': 'stephenbma43@gmail.com', 'username': 'stephen-ma'}, {'_account_id': 7249, 'name': 'Ann Taraday', 'email': 'akamyshnikova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AKamyshnikova'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10184, 'name': 'Nuage CI', 'email': 'nuage-ci@nuagenetworks.net', 'username': 'nuage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14323, 'name': 'HP Networking CI', 'email': 'hpnopenstackci@hp.com', 'username': 'hpn'}, {'_account_id': 16707, 'name': 'Mohankumar', 'email': 'nmohankumar1011@gmail.com', 'username': 'mohankumar_n'}, {'_account_id': 20178, 'name': 'Tore Anderson', 'email': 'tore@fud.no'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-15 21:58:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_keepalived.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/keepalived.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py'], 'message': "Fix L3 HA with IPv6

We currently use garp_master_repeat and garp_master_refresh
to solve bug 1453855. We need to spawn keepalived only after
all of the qr/qg ports have been wired so that the
initial GARP will be properly sent. Otherwise you get a routing
black hole. In lieu of a proper sync method, we used those two keepalived
options to send GARPs repeatedly:

a) We did not know it never stops spamming the network
b) It causes VMs to lose their IPv6 default gateway due to a keepalived
   bug, which has since been fixed, but it would need to be backported
   to every keepalived version on every distro. Here's the patch:
   https://github.com/acassen/keepalived/pull/200

The solution this patch proposes is to drop the repeat and refresh
keepalived options. This will fix the IPv6 bug but re-introduce bug
1453855. So, this patch uses the delay option instead. It turns
out keepalived sends a GARP when it transitions to MASTER, and then
it waits a number of seconds determined by the delay option, and
sends a GARP again. We'll use an aggressive 'delay' setting to make
sure that when the node boots and the L3/L2 agents start, we'll
give the L2 agent enough time to wire the ports as a stopgap solution.
Note that this only affects initial synchronization time, not failover
times. Failover times will continue to be fast because the ports
are wired ahead of time, the initial GARP after the state transition
to MASTER will be sent properly.

Change-Id: I7a086472b8742828dae08ffd915c45e94fb4b94e
Closes-Bug: #1520517
Related-Bug: #1453855
"}]
commit_message:
Fix L3 HA with IPv6

We currently use garp_master_repeat and garp_master_refresh
to solve bug 1453855. We need to spawn keepalived only after
all of the qr/qg ports have been wired so that the
initial GARP will be properly sent. Otherwise you get a routing
black hole. In lieu of a proper sync method, we used those two keepalived
options to send GARPs repeatedly:

a) We did not know it never stops spamming the network
b) It causes VMs to lose their IPv6 default gateway due to a keepalived
   bug, which has since been fixed, but it would need to be backported
   to every keepalived version on every distro. Here's the patch:
   https://github.com/acassen/keepalived/pull/200

The solution this patch proposes is to drop the repeat and refresh
keepalived options. This will fix the IPv6 bug but re-introduce bug
1453855. So, this patch uses the delay option instead. It turns
out keepalived sends a GARP when it transitions to MASTER, and then
it waits a number of seconds determined by the delay option, and
sends a GARP again. We'll use an aggressive 'delay' setting to make
sure that when the node boots and the L3/L2 agents start, we'll
give the L2 agent enough time to wire the ports as a stopgap solution.
Note that this only affects initial synchronization time, not failover
times. Failover times will continue to be fast because the ports
are wired ahead of time, the initial GARP after the state transition
to MASTER will be sent properly.

Change-Id: I7a086472b8742828dae08ffd915c45e94fb4b94e
Closes-Bug: #1520517
Related-Bug: #1453855

subject: Sync with openstack/requirements master branch
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-26 06:39:37.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini', 'watcherclient/tests/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Sync with openstack/requirements master branch

In order to accept the requirements contract defined in
openstack/requirements, we need to sync with the master branch of that
project's global-requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt files.

Most of the changes are just version changes and nothing major.  The
only major changes are:

1) Removing httpretty and therefore needing to update the test_shell.py
file which uses httpretty.  It seems like the code that was dependent on
httpretty is not even being ran as part of the UTs, so this code was
removed.

2) The twine dependency is removed, and therefore the pypi tox
environment was also removed.

Change-Id: I939856e9b0a32792bea45b42c489dc9bbbe62782
Closes-Bug: #1533283
"}]
commit_message:
Sync with openstack/requirements master branch

In order to accept the requirements contract defined in
openstack/requirements, we need to sync with the master branch of that
project's global-requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt files.

Most of the changes are just version changes and nothing major.  The
only major changes are:

1) Removing httpretty and therefore needing to update the test_shell.py
file which uses httpretty.  It seems like the code that was dependent on
httpretty is not even being ran as part of the UTs, so this code was
removed.

2) The twine dependency is removed, and therefore the pypi tox
environment was also removed.

Change-Id: I939856e9b0a32792bea45b42c489dc9bbbe62782
Closes-Bug: #1533283

subject: Update bashate lint checks re: E005, E006, E040
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-09 09:32:42.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-docs/scripts.rst', 'playbooks/roles/os_neutron/templates/plugins/plumgrid/pgrc', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Update bashate lint checks re: E005, E006, E040

Backport note:
This patch merges three related patches.

Patch 1: Resolve bashate violation E005

This patch implements changes required to resolve bashate violation
E005 and also improves the tox config to improve the search for
bash scripts in the repository.

(cherry picked from commit 360b44c6cec8fc956adf92bc28c3a1bf01f1247f)

Patch 2: Add notes about bashate E006 exception

bashate tests fail with 'E006: Line longer than 79 columns'.

As many scripts are deployed as templates and use jinja templating,
this rule is very difficult to achieve. It is still considered a
preference and should be a goal to improve readability, within reason.

Validation of this reasoning will be up to the human reviewers instead
of being forced by the lint tests.

(cherry picked from commit b9eb3699dee6a58d02348de0d5a8f903ed765ce7)

Patch 3: Add bashate E040 exception

As many scripts are deployed as templates and use use jinja templating,
this will often fail. This test is reasonably safely ignored as the
syntax error will be identified when executing the resulting script.

(cherry picked from commit 03db583b6e59fe0bb000f7d28cfd65e96d208ca3)

Change-Id: I4531126b850d54dc06e29bd9b5cf21fbff87bfd3
"}]
commit_message:
Update bashate lint checks re: E005, E006, E040

Backport note:
This patch merges three related patches.

Patch 1: Resolve bashate violation E005

This patch implements changes required to resolve bashate violation
E005 and also improves the tox config to improve the search for
bash scripts in the repository.

(cherry picked from commit 360b44c6cec8fc956adf92bc28c3a1bf01f1247f)

Patch 2: Add notes about bashate E006 exception

bashate tests fail with 'E006: Line longer than 79 columns'.

As many scripts are deployed as templates and use jinja templating,
this rule is very difficult to achieve. It is still considered a
preference and should be a goal to improve readability, within reason.

Validation of this reasoning will be up to the human reviewers instead
of being forced by the lint tests.

(cherry picked from commit b9eb3699dee6a58d02348de0d5a8f903ed765ce7)

Patch 3: Add bashate E040 exception

As many scripts are deployed as templates and use use jinja templating,
this will often fail. This test is reasonably safely ignored as the
syntax error will be identified when executing the resulting script.

(cherry picked from commit 03db583b6e59fe0bb000f7d28cfd65e96d208ca3)

Change-Id: I4531126b850d54dc06e29bd9b5cf21fbff87bfd3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 20:58:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py'], 'message': "Stops update_network() from using bad attributes

Currently update_network() has no checks for ensuring the network
variable is not updated with invalid parameters. This was causing
certain update commands to fail (such as updating dns_domain). The
actual update to dns_domain is handled elsewhere, but this function
was also trying to process it and causing an error.

This patch ensures the network variable is only updated with attributes
that are actually in the Network model by filtering out any parameters
that don't match fields in the Network class model.

Change-Id: I082b047e9df15e9215dc52d7e26abb45f615d291
Closes-bug: 1541560
"}]
commit_message:
Stops update_network() from using bad attributes

Currently update_network() has no checks for ensuring the network
variable is not updated with invalid parameters. This was causing
certain update commands to fail (such as updating dns_domain). The
actual update to dns_domain is handled elsewhere, but this function
was also trying to process it and causing an error.

This patch ensures the network variable is only updated with attributes
that are actually in the Network model by filtering out any parameters
that don't match fields in the Network class model.

Change-Id: I082b047e9df15e9215dc52d7e26abb45f615d291
Closes-bug: 1541560

commit_message:
[WIP] Refactor IPv6 testing

Change the v6 scenario tests to only boot one VM. Eventually this patch
will rework all the tests so that we just spwan a guest instance and
ping6 or SSH into the instance from the Tempest node, instead of booting
two instances, which is slow and expensive.

Change-Id: I0976f450dea0e1b49aa62cad5857b24f9016b8e3

commit_message:
Use boolean value when using the cinder API

For non mysql databases (i.e. PostgreSQL) casting an integer
to a bool doesn't work automatically so using the correct type
fixes the problem.

Change-Id: Ie347d43da8a78b4fe586b4c73b42dd31d0e0bc85
Closes-Bug: #1452888

commit_message:
API to manually clean nodes

This adds an API to allow manual cleaning of nodes, via
PUT /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/states/provision. The argument
'target' is 'clean', and the argument 'clean_steps' (the
list of clean steps to be performed on the node) must be
specified.

The API version is bumped to 1.15.

Change-Id: I0e34407133684e34c4ab9446b3521a24f3038f92
Partial-Bug: #1526290

subject: [package_cache] Lock usage_mem_lock based on package id
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-04 00:06:46.000000000', 'files': ['murano/engine/package_loader.py', 'murano/tests/unit/engine/test_package_loader.py'], 'message': '[package_cache] Lock usage_mem_lock based on package id

Previously usage_cache incorrectly used the whole definition as key.
This lead to incorrect deletion of package cache during downloads.
This commit also updates the way errors during exclusive package are
handled and updates test to include cleanup, deletion and non-deletion
of cached packages

Implements bp: murano-engine-package-cache

Change-Id: I6567d60fe5094c4ff06a87d9392f71e319f93d9c
'}]
commit_message:
[package_cache] Lock usage_mem_lock based on package id

Previously usage_cache incorrectly used the whole definition as key.
This lead to incorrect deletion of package cache during downloads.
This commit also updates the way errors during exclusive package are
handled and updates test to include cleanup, deletion and non-deletion
of cached packages

Implements bp: murano-engine-package-cache

Change-Id: I6567d60fe5094c4ff06a87d9392f71e319f93d9c

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-26 19:12:05.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/packaging.py', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/locales/de/LC_MESSAGES/bar.po', 'test-requirements.txt', 'pbr/tests/test_commands.py', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/locales/zh_CN/LC_MESSAGES/messages.po', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/setup.cfg', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/locales/de/LC_MESSAGES/foo.po', 'pbr/hooks/commands.py', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/locales/foo.pot', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/locales/de/LC_MESSAGES/messages.po', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/locales/bar.pot', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/locales/zh_CN/LC_MESSAGES/foo.po', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/locales/zh_CN/LC_MESSAGES/bar.po'], 'message': 'Extend compile_catalog command to compile all .po files

By default the command "compile_catalog" of the setup integration of
babel only compiles one .po file per language into .mo files, that is
<domain>.po.  All other .po files that might exist have been ignored
and therefore probably not used by packages.  This change extends the
setup command 'compile_catalogs', so that it now accepts in the
'domain' setting either a space separated list of domains or the
value '_AUTO_', in which case it looks for all .pot files in the
language directory and treats each of them as a domain.  Then it
iterates over all domains and calls "compile_catalog" for each of
them.

Change-Id: Ib5392e23436194161913315cfd6b725ea8420f03
Closes-Bug: #1536226
'}]
commit_message:
Extend compile_catalog command to compile all .po files

By default the command "compile_catalog" of the setup integration of
babel only compiles one .po file per language into .mo files, that is
<domain>.po.  All other .po files that might exist have been ignored
and therefore probably not used by packages.  This change extends the
setup command 'compile_catalogs', so that it now accepts in the
'domain' setting either a space separated list of domains or the
value '_AUTO_', in which case it looks for all .pot files in the
language directory and treats each of them as a domain.  Then it
iterates over all domains and calls "compile_catalog" for each of
them.

Change-Id: Ib5392e23436194161913315cfd6b725ea8420f03
Closes-Bug: #1536226

subject: Join flavor when re-querying instance for floating ip association
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6508, 'name': 'Dmitry Stepanenko', 'email': 'dstepanenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dstepanenko'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-05 18:16:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_api.py'], 'message': 'Join flavor when re-querying instance for floating ip association

The network api code re-queries the instance to get the "current" version of
it before doing a floating ip association. This query does not include flavor,
which causes us to almost immediately lazy-load it in the call to
update_instance_with_nw_info(). This patch fixes that by asking for it
in the first place.

Change-Id: I4606ca5ec280a191697f1e100d8f09e5fb03260a
Partial-bug: #1540526
'}]
commit_message:
Join flavor when re-querying instance for floating ip association

The network api code re-queries the instance to get the "current" version of
it before doing a floating ip association. This query does not include flavor,
which causes us to almost immediately lazy-load it in the call to
update_instance_with_nw_info(). This patch fixes that by asking for it
in the first place.

Change-Id: I4606ca5ec280a191697f1e100d8f09e5fb03260a
Partial-bug: #1540526

commit_message:
Use instance in setup_networks_on_host

This patch add instance param to setup_networks_on_host
rpcapi. This allows to remove redundant db query, to
get instance by instance_id.

Change-Id: I574d645b93e3e042266a7dd306fc54ee46e2799f

commit_message:
Remove periodic-qa pipeline in favor of periodic

Now that the SMTP reporter has been removed from the periodic-qa
pipeline, it doesn't do anything that the periodic pipeline doesn't
already do, so collapse its jobs into the latter.

commit_message:
Add new DB API method to retrieve migration for instance

New API to force live migration to complete and to cancel ongoing live
migration will take server id and migration id as arguments.
This patch adds new method to DB API to retrieve migration with given
id for particular instance id.

Partially implements: blueprint pause-vm-during-live-migration
Change-Id: I2eebf2a16b03a327348557b88fa573cb40917e9b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-09 15:47:14.000000000', 'files': ['devops/helpers/helpers.py'], 'message': "Fix slave IP address getting

We use a MAC address to match devops and nailgun nodes.
Sometimes the MAC address of the br-fw-admin bridge
on an already deployed environment has been changed
to the OVS interface MAC.
In that cases we couldn't get an IP by a new MAC,
but the old MAC is stored as a part of the name of the node.
Fix changes expression that is used for getting IP.

Change-Id: Icf1ff0a85f3a5555d1b7d70a652b2aba9b8f5606
Closes-Bug:1542275
"}]
commit_message:
Fix slave IP address getting

We use a MAC address to match devops and nailgun nodes.
Sometimes the MAC address of the br-fw-admin bridge
on an already deployed environment has been changed
to the OVS interface MAC.
In that cases we couldn't get an IP by a new MAC,
but the old MAC is stored as a part of the name of the node.
Fix changes expression that is used for getting IP.

Change-Id: Icf1ff0a85f3a5555d1b7d70a652b2aba9b8f5606
Closes-Bug:1542275

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-18 05:07:23.000000000', 'files': ['openstack-common.conf'], 'message': "remove openstack-common.conf

We don't sync from oslo-incubator, so don't need this file any more.
In sahara project it was copy from oslo-incubator, openstack-common.conf
is oslo-incubator project for which the module configuration file
synchronization, there are no specific projects specific role.
we can get rid of this file.

Change-Id: I1794781cc3860b7c2aecdc9cd9cdf9730a392ee9
"}]
commit_message:
remove openstack-common.conf

We don't sync from oslo-incubator, so don't need this file any more.
In sahara project it was copy from oslo-incubator, openstack-common.conf
is oslo-incubator project for which the module configuration file
synchronization, there are no specific projects specific role.
we can get rid of this file.

Change-Id: I1794781cc3860b7c2aecdc9cd9cdf9730a392ee9

subject: Reworked unit test for action service apis
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-09 10:46:59.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_actions.py', 'senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/policies/deletion_policy.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/test_rpc_client.py', 'senlin/engine/actions/base.py', 'senlin/rpc/client.py'], 'message': 'Reworked unit test for action service apis

We have been creating things for real in unit tests. This is a bad
behavior because it induces a huge overhead into unit tests. Another
aspect is sometimes we are testing too much. It is making the unit test
a partial functional test. This patch reworks the unit test for action
related APIs.

Change-Id: Ia8170604060b33c440b9901c9d4b0f8798ec9d44
'}]
commit_message:
Reworked unit test for action service apis

We have been creating things for real in unit tests. This is a bad
behavior because it induces a huge overhead into unit tests. Another
aspect is sometimes we are testing too much. It is making the unit test
a partial functional test. This patch reworks the unit test for action
related APIs.

Change-Id: Ia8170604060b33c440b9901c9d4b0f8798ec9d44

The main goal of those changes is to extend the support that libvirt
has.  If the image has setup a value('os_uefi_loader_path') in its

Implements: blueprint boot-from-uefi

commit_message:
Added support to boot instances from UEFI

The main goal of those changes is to extend the support that libvirt
has.  If the image has setup a value('os_uefi_loader_path') in its
metadata, it'll boot from UEFI instead of BIOS.

Change-Id: I6e71b3996d44eed1d421b876037afa51751e3cd8
Implements: blueprint boot-from-uefi

commit_message:
Update configure_mirror to use per-region APT mirrors

Now that we have per-region apt mirrors for ubuntu, we should use them.
As part of doing that we need to disable looking for i386 packages since
we do not mirror nor use those - and we need to tell APT to not check
the GPG signatures of our mirror archive since we're not signing it.

We don't need multiverse or restricted in the gate, and they also
contain non-free software. Remove them from our configuration.

Change-Id: I26f5fc5cec224cf4f4ea361e0f71cecbf320fbb0

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-09 12:35:00.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/logging.pp', 'spec/classes/mistral_db_spec.rb', 'manifests/api.pp', 'manifests/db.pp', 'manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/executor.pp', 'spec/classes/mistral_init_spec.rb', 'README.md', 'spec/classes/mistral_keystone_auth_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/mistral_logging_spec.rb', 'manifests/engine.pp', 'spec/classes/mistral_api_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/mistral_engine_spec.rb', 'manifests/params.pp', 'manifests/services.pp', 'spec/classes/mistral_executor_spec.rb', 'manifests/keystone/auth.pp'], 'message': 'Refactor puppet-mistral

The module was written in a way that was not consistent with other
Puppet OpenStack modules, the interface was very different.

This patch:
* add db.pp
* update logging.pp with usual parameters
* drop useless parameters in keystone/auth.pp
* cleanup params.pp
* drop services.pp, which is useless
* Update unit tests
* Add coordination support in init.pp
* Some alignment issues
* Add more doc in README
* Stop including ::mistral in all classes
* Include mistral::policy in mistral::api

This is a non-backward compatible change, but since the module has no
release and no stable branch, also very new, this is not something we
need to care at this stage.
People using this module at this stage will have to update their
manifests otherwise their Puppet catalog will fail.

Change-Id: I979e21caa71ee35337dc01b225878701868e966a
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor puppet-mistral

The module was written in a way that was not consistent with other
Puppet OpenStack modules, the interface was very different.

This patch:
* add db.pp
* update logging.pp with usual parameters
* drop useless parameters in keystone/auth.pp
* cleanup params.pp
* drop services.pp, which is useless
* Update unit tests
* Add coordination support in init.pp
* Some alignment issues
* Add more doc in README
* Stop including ::mistral in all classes
* Include mistral::policy in mistral::api

This is a non-backward compatible change, but since the module has no
release and no stable branch, also very new, this is not something we
need to care at this stage.
People using this module at this stage will have to update their
manifests otherwise their Puppet catalog will fail.

Change-Id: I979e21caa71ee35337dc01b225878701868e966a

subject: Make _poll_for_status more user-friendly
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-04 18:07:40.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/exceptions.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Make _poll_for_status more user-friendly

NOTE: _poll_for_status is a private method, which is used only in shell
      module, so we can modify it without backward compatibility.

_poll_for_status is used for various resources with different interfaces.

In case of snapshotting, it works with Image resources, which doesn't have
"fault" attribute in "error" state. To prevent AttributeError, we should take
this into account.

Also, an exception raised by _poll_for_status(InstanceInErrorState) should
not be hardcoded for one type of resource, so this exception is renamed to
ResourceInErrorState. An exception InstanceInDeletedState, which is also
can be raised by _poll_for_status, is not modified, since I don't know cases
when it can be used with resources other than Server.

Change-Id: Ie0ee96999376cbf608caa1cf8521dbef5c939b52
Closes-Bug: #1538073
'}]
commit_message:
Make _poll_for_status more user-friendly

NOTE: _poll_for_status is a private method, which is used only in shell
      module, so we can modify it without backward compatibility.

_poll_for_status is used for various resources with different interfaces.

In case of snapshotting, it works with Image resources, which doesn't have
"fault" attribute in "error" state. To prevent AttributeError, we should take
this into account.

Also, an exception raised by _poll_for_status(InstanceInErrorState) should
not be hardcoded for one type of resource, so this exception is renamed to
ResourceInErrorState. An exception InstanceInDeletedState, which is also
can be raised by _poll_for_status, is not modified, since I don't know cases
when it can be used with resources other than Server.

Change-Id: Ie0ee96999376cbf608caa1cf8521dbef5c939b52
Closes-Bug: #1538073

config_template module using the INI configuration type. This change is needed

OpenStack service oslo.config properlly handles the lists as a comma seperated

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Updated config parsing for listOPS

This change updates the list parsing for all list options passed through the
config_template module using the INI configuration type. This change is needed
so that when passing a list into a configuration file for use within an
OpenStack service oslo.config properlly handles the lists as a comma seperated
value when rendered.

Closes-Bug: #1543588
Change-Id: If8055b3362f1d9d1f274baa447fac094a6a91481
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
docker-logs added to snapshot

Fabric failes on long file names due to copy docker-logs
subdirectories into snapshot.
As hotfix we implicitly set configuration for docker-logs in the Nailgun
settings.yaml.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 17:29:19.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/swift/proxy.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/swift/swift_spec.rb'], 'message': "Add a new swift_backups section in rsync conf

On primary controller we are executing all stuff (like ring create, rebalance and etc).
Swift Ring Builder requires folder '/etc/swift/backups' with proper permissions (2770).

On another controllers, we just run rsync from primary, for '/etc/swift/backups' directory.
The problem is that we are using settings from swift_server section (which comes from
swift upstream module). This section has default incoming_chmod/outgoing_chmod = '0644'.
Hense all another controllers have these permissions for '/etc/swift/backups'.
In case, when we want to destroy old primary + add new controller - we faced with wrong
permissions for '/etc/swift/backups' on all controller nodes.

Change-Id: I47ee344e6ea6d65eb984941287ec9c0ed3e28a5b
Related-bug: #1518305
Closes-bug: #1542281
(cherry picked from commit 1a5e0e726f83687f5c14b9ae0e616e3acb83b236)
"}]
commit_message:
Add a new swift_backups section in rsync conf

On primary controller we are executing all stuff (like ring create, rebalance and etc).
Swift Ring Builder requires folder '/etc/swift/backups' with proper permissions (2770).

On another controllers, we just run rsync from primary, for '/etc/swift/backups' directory.
The problem is that we are using settings from swift_server section (which comes from
swift upstream module). This section has default incoming_chmod/outgoing_chmod = '0644'.
Hense all another controllers have these permissions for '/etc/swift/backups'.
In case, when we want to destroy old primary + add new controller - we faced with wrong
permissions for '/etc/swift/backups' on all controller nodes.

Change-Id: I47ee344e6ea6d65eb984941287ec9c0ed3e28a5b
Related-bug: #1518305
Closes-bug: #1542281
(cherry picked from commit 1a5e0e726f83687f5c14b9ae0e616e3acb83b236)

commit_message:
Add wait to DFDaemon class.

Add the method wait to the DFDaemon class. This will allow threads to
wait for one another to finish.

This is useful in case one threads needs to wait for another thread to
finish a task before continuing.

Change-Id: I6972477f38e1980d0a8bfea6072d2d5410872fef

commit_message:
Add install priority to each service

- Now each service has its own install priority
  that defines its installation order.
  By default is 1.
- Set Hue priority to 2 that is less than
  priority of other services.

Change-Id: I37dcf8d84c05206a104b702a5f4be8d6cbb875d0
Closes-Bug: #1540341

subject: Ensure description exists for HTTP error.
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-02-09 08:02:45.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchiclient/tests/unit/test_exceptions.py', 'gnocchiclient/exceptions.py'], 'message': "Ensure description exists for HTTP error.

Don't fail if the HTTP error raised with json payload but
not in the expect format.

For example, the json returned by Keystone is not the same
as the Gnocchi one.

Any middleware between Gnocchi and the Webserver can potentialy
return json.

This change handles these cases gracefully instead of raising
a TypeError.

Closes-bug: #1543449

Change-Id: Id824ed4753271a4451881656293b53132ff3eb84
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure description exists for HTTP error.

Don't fail if the HTTP error raised with json payload but
not in the expect format.

For example, the json returned by Keystone is not the same
as the Gnocchi one.

Any middleware between Gnocchi and the Webserver can potentialy
return json.

This change handles these cases gracefully instead of raising
a TypeError.

Closes-bug: #1543449

Change-Id: Id824ed4753271a4451881656293b53132ff3eb84

commit_message:
Set gate-grenade-dsvm-multinode to non-voting

Failure rates have been creeping up and the integrated gate
jobs are churning on this issue. Let's switch off voting
for now while we try to diagnose the root cause and fix it.

Related-Bug: #1536622
Change-Id: I88293243b26991e047d3dd345915896235e22345

(cherry picked from commit e5b3988c7cb01d2230f67c41aa76935a11b0e42a in Ceilometer)

commit_message:
Update alarm history only if change in alarm property

When alarm's property is updated with the same value, an empty record is
added to the alarm history output.

This fix omits the update to alarm history if there no changes to any
alarm property.

Closes-Bug: #1465550
(cherry picked from commit e5b3988c7cb01d2230f67c41aa76935a11b0e42a in Ceilometer)

Change-Id: I42014a1d207bb32e81e8f09b65857d0608bba675

commit_message:
New 4-th group of "nightly" functional ui tests for fuel-web.

"Nodes across environment" test group:
  Node settings pop-up contains environment and node network group names
  Standard and Compact Node view support
  Quick Search support for "Equipment" page
  Quick Search results saved after refreshing of page
  Quick Search results saved after switching to other page
  Sorting support for "Equipment" page
  Filtering support for "Equipment" page
  Sorting and Filtering results saved after refreshing of page
  Sorting and Filtering results saved after switching to other page
  "Offline" node deletion from "Equipment" page
  Node groups segmentation on "Equipment" page

Change-Id: I6a6d1b4f9e6697399face92a4ddbc95f3744ee18

commit_message:
Fixed some other warnings in tests, then remove tests from exclude

Fix some other warnings in tests, and then let's remove the "tests" from
tox.flake8.exclude:
 * O325 Not using translating helper for logging
 * H404  multi line docstring should start without a leading new line
 * H201  no 'except:' at least use 'except Exception:'

Change-Id: I87287b1f9f5e87add18aee2f7989da337c64ccc2

commit_message:
Add debtcollector as requirement

oslo.config imports debtcollector but does not require it.

This now leads to build failures for projects importing oslo.config
like:
http://logs.openstack.org/97/277697/1/check/gate-openstack-manuals-tox-checkniceness/1729088/console.html#_2016-02-09_06_50_36_536

Change-Id: I4c598b338592a56c8a0b447c5fdfaf3f5c2f4876

commit_message:
Prevent unexpected exception if provision fail

Two problem fixed:

- do not fail if no nodes were sent to reboot;
- in case of exception unlock nodes by uids instead of names

Change-Id: Iafe9c78e7a92c9f410c9452748b242a6fe8140e4
Closes-Bug: #1540360

commit_message:

subject: raise coordination error if not registered
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-08 12:51:26.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/coordination.py'], 'message': 'raise coordination error if not registered

in the scenario where an agent does not get registered in group,
try to rejoin group. if not successful after 5 attempts, give up
and raise.

also, cherry-pick I6a48cf38b24a00a0db94d3dea0c6746b52526026
Change-Id: Ic0b6b62dace88e4e1ce7932024350bb211efb9ef
'}]
commit_message:
raise coordination error if not registered

in the scenario where an agent does not get registered in group,
try to rejoin group. if not successful after 5 attempts, give up
and raise.

also, cherry-pick I6a48cf38b24a00a0db94d3dea0c6746b52526026
Change-Id: Ic0b6b62dace88e4e1ce7932024350bb211efb9ef

commit_message:
Drop branch selection on oslo-master periodic job

Periodic jobs cannot have a branch selection. So fix
the branch to always use master.

Change-Id: Ida35e8f8fe5a631e12e77936325e557acef91a35

Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

subprocess module.

commit_message:
Remove astute.yaml and use them as fixtures

* Set fixtures default for the fuel_noop_tests.rb
* If bundler required, run bundle install/update before
  the "rake spec_prep" command in the fuel_noop_tests.rb
* Add docs for external astute.yaml noop fixtures

DocImpact: Noop tests framework dev docs

Partial blueprint deployment-data-dryrun

Change-Id: Ibee7967ec2bd84df8d2f836fc38189cf0f0a8f6a
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Prevent concurrent initialisation of the mechanism driver.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-19 13:27:13.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/mech_calico.py'], 'message': "Prevent concurrent initialisation of the mechanism driver.

A recent FV run managed to get two concurrent initialisations
resulting in spammy error logs, if not incorrect behaviour.

Let's just use a lock to avoid getting this wrong.

Change-Id: I2d1f6b42e27ed5690d1620f5dbc26c5aa03fa4f9
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent concurrent initialisation of the mechanism driver.

A recent FV run managed to get two concurrent initialisations
resulting in spammy error logs, if not incorrect behaviour.

Let's just use a lock to avoid getting this wrong.

Change-Id: I2d1f6b42e27ed5690d1620f5dbc26c5aa03fa4f9

There is a misconfigured parameters when freezer client tries to create a
keystone instance for version 3 using tokens in which project_name and
project_domain_name are expecting values that does not exists

Closes-bug: 1543156

Change-Id: Ic1baea868e8b7d64fd3cb803e0637225a4a82d46
'}]
commit_message:
Fix typo in keystone v3 creation dict

There is a misconfigured parameters when freezer client tries to create a
keystone instance for version 3 using tokens in which project_name and
project_domain_name are expecting values that does not exists

Closes-bug: 1543156

Change-Id: Ic1baea868e8b7d64fd3cb803e0637225a4a82d46

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-07 16:22:50.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/utils/__init__.py'], 'message': "Redundent if Statement

The 'if' statement is redundant, because __getattr__ method only gets
invoked for attributes that are not in the __dict__ attribute, therefore,
if __getattr__ is called it means that the attribute is not in __dict__

Change-Id: I68b975c2e03395db90d421e3180cea81e9af271b
"}]
commit_message:
Redundent if Statement

The 'if' statement is redundant, because __getattr__ method only gets
invoked for attributes that are not in the __dict__ attribute, therefore,
if __getattr__ is called it means that the attribute is not in __dict__

Change-Id: I68b975c2e03395db90d421e3180cea81e9af271b

commit_message:
Set new ml2::ovs parameters to use service default

New parameters should be set to $::os_service_default when possible.
This is especially important since restarting the OVS agent will drop
all flows in releases before Liberty and on Liberty if
drop_flows_on_start is true.

Change-Id: I7a406a7f24e95d5ce18fd52a0b15d4be72d615e2

commit_message:
repos: update ceph repo apt pin url

A recent change [1] modified the default ceph repo from ceph.com to
download.ceph.com.

This patch aims to update the apt pin configuration so we download
packages from there and not from UCA.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceph/commit/c59467369dd2e6f54ed9a7d94176f8639941b8f5

Change-Id: Iff1924cf4ddda67fe9519c971eba0603453bf100

subject: Remove all 'validate_array' statements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-14 11:07:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/cluster/zookeeper.pp', 'manifests/cluster/cassandra.pp', 'manifests/network/midonet/api.pp', 'manifests/network/midonet/agent.pp'], 'message': "Remove all 'validate_array' statements

Unfortunately, some distributions like CentOS 7 (I guess RedHat 7 as
well) still using puppet < 3.7, which experience the annoying 'PUP-1299'
bug:

https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-1299

So passing a single array element, it magically transforms to a string
(or whatever the inside elements are) and the validate_array fails. We
need to get rid of these validations.

Change-Id: Icc22ee575b7c236d1a6358f8593cf813d339a4b5
(cherry picked from commit 7260c13fbeac8bf34da30d70f449412f3628e2f7)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove all 'validate_array' statements

Unfortunately, some distributions like CentOS 7 (I guess RedHat 7 as
well) still using puppet < 3.7, which experience the annoying 'PUP-1299'
bug:

https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-1299

So passing a single array element, it magically transforms to a string
(or whatever the inside elements are) and the validate_array fails. We
need to get rid of these validations.

Change-Id: Icc22ee575b7c236d1a6358f8593cf813d339a4b5
(cherry picked from commit 7260c13fbeac8bf34da30d70f449412f3628e2f7)

commit_message:
[Core-Library] Add ability to specify direction and ethetype for groups

Previously there was no way to specify in which direction security rule
should be applied, only ingress was supported. Also it was impossible
to create IPv6 rules.
This patch added ability to specify direction and ethertype for
Neutron security groups and direction - for AWS security groups

Change-Id: Iba5be7a8a94c34eab3e0e06f95e5358a84a5dd7b
Closes-Bug: #1532317
(cherry picked from commit 186612daf708b0ad3199bbf77ea8d3ed0f5eb48e)

commit_message:
enginefacade: remove 'get_session' and 'get_api_session'

Removed 'get_session' and 'get_api_session' methods which were
needed for backward compatibility. Cleanup with 'save' method.
Fixed 'xen_api' tests to use Instance object instead of Instance
db model.

Implements: blueprint new-oslodb-enginefacade

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Nikitin <snikitin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I5367f4495b060171afe9a2ddaebeb4c43fb6af78

commit_message:
docker-logs added to snapshot

We have an issue in Shotgun with copy log subdirectories log into
snapshot, when exclude is used for dir in settings.yaml.
As hotfix we restore configuration for docker-logs in the Nailgun
settings.yaml.

Change-Id: Ifc1699f67981484ff44eefb92c5a2f9d8fa5997d
Closes-Bug: #1541390

subject: Fixes incorrect endpoint_override handling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 12:33:08.000000000', 'files': ['muranoclient/common/http.py'], 'message': 'Fixes incorrect endpoint_override handling

When both session and endpoint_override parameters
were passed to the Client a TypeError exception was raised
because the parameter was expected to be the first one
in positional args but **kwargs were also passed to the
SessionClient

Change-Id: Iba0786a4f81d25dbfaf2b10791ddc6190deb81f2
Closes-Bug: #1543090
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes incorrect endpoint_override handling

When both session and endpoint_override parameters
were passed to the Client a TypeError exception was raised
because the parameter was expected to be the first one
in positional args but **kwargs were also passed to the
SessionClient

Change-Id: Iba0786a4f81d25dbfaf2b10791ddc6190deb81f2

commit_message:
Load kernel modules if needed

Add new parameters which make l23network module more flexible in cases
when it is needed to do nothing with modules or manage them outside this
module.
Tests were corrected with passing default values because exported
k_mod resources are not working correctly.

Change-Id: I191852c54d2e9b6d1227194e2b907b7d035eb0d7
Closes-bug: #1541028

It's better to parse value from config and set verify flag with it.

subject: better support notification coordination
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-26 18:47:50.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/coordination.py', 'ceilometer/notification.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-agent-coordination-a7103a78fecaec24.yaml'], 'message': 'better support notification coordination

when launching multiple agents at same time, there is a chance that
agents will miss the registry of another agent. this is possible
because there is a lot of overhead involved when starting up agents,
specifically with initialising managers.

this change makes it so the agent only joins the group AFTER it has
done all setup that does not require coordination. after it joins,
we start listening right away for other changes to group membership

additionally, this adds a lock to pipeline queue setup so only one
event at any time can trigger a reconfiguration.

Change-Id: I8100160a3aa83a190c4110e6e8be9b26aef8fd1c
Closes-Bug: #1533787
'}]
commit_message:
better support notification coordination

when launching multiple agents at same time, there is a chance that
agents will miss the registry of another agent. this is possible
because there is a lot of overhead involved when starting up agents,
specifically with initialising managers.

this change makes it so the agent only joins the group AFTER it has
done all setup that does not require coordination. after it joins,
we start listening right away for other changes to group membership

additionally, this adds a lock to pipeline queue setup so only one
event at any time can trigger a reconfiguration.

Change-Id: I8100160a3aa83a190c4110e6e8be9b26aef8fd1c
Closes-Bug: #1533787

commit_message:
Fix bashisms

There's 3 scripts which include bashisms, which would fail in Debian,
where the default shell interpreter for sh is dash, and not bash.
This patch fixes these bashisms. It also fixes the wrong interpreter
path in iser_rename.erb.

Change-Id: Ic3415e3d07bc9dce1af2fbdf7fdbfead5264d788
Closes-Bug: #1542971

This reduces nodepool usage across all OpenStack-Ansible and some

Change-Id: If9979dc0cad8418bedf7a342754ab68394e0a214
"}]
commit_message:
Switch non-infra Ansible roles to using 'linters' tox target

This patch implements a change from individual pep8/ansible-lint/etc
lint jobs to using a unified 'linters' tox target.

This reduces nodepool usage across all OpenStack-Ansible and some
other Ansible role repositories.

Change-Id: If9979dc0cad8418bedf7a342754ab68394e0a214

commit_message:
Remove tooz testing of etcd/consul on liberty or kilo

These drivers didn't exist in either of these releases
so testing against them will always fail, so just avoid
testing them in the first place.

Change-Id: Iae56e82f907222fd1698520b21e112319db247ca

commit_message:
Use all available ipaddresses as SAN for master nginx

As master node nginx must be acceccible from any network it has
and nginx listen on every interface, all IP addresses from them
must be used in TLS certificate for proper connection.

Change-Id: Ib7121af26fffbe011a616b3ffdabb45dc273c3ce
Closes-Bug: #1517893

commit_message:
Add LXD experimental Tempest job for Manila

New driver (LXC/LXD) is going to be added to Manila.
So, register new Tempest job for it.
Make it run only for M+ branches in experimental pipeline
and only as nonvoting until it is merged and becomes stable.

Change-Id: I81d9ecaf3cfb62adafea7e5e038b0ab91d952119

commit_message:
Add ZFSonLinux experimental Tempest job for Manila

New driver ZFSonLinux is going to be added to Manila project.
So, register new Tempest job for it.
Make it run only for M+ branches in experimental pipeline
and only as nonvoting until it is merged and becomes stable.

Change-Id: Ic675c5dfa772d47c02d16257ed0eefc286facd03

commit_message:
Adds resource_classes lookup table to API DB

Adds a simple lookup table for resource classes to the API database.

Since this is a lookup table only, it doesn't need TimestampMixin, so I
changed the default base metaclass for API DB models to not base on
TimestampMixin.

Change-Id: I2ea80a4cd60fb86c5169812920455e2fdd747fee
Blueprint: resource-providers

commit_message:
Adds ResourceClass field type definition

Adds a new Enum field type definition for the class of resources that
will be handled in the resource providers system.

Resources are simple quantities of some consumable thing. Resource
classes are the types of those resources that may be requested by a user
when launching an instance.

Change-Id: Iea44ed125c378d5712e89201d76261b6ead0ae2e
Blueprint: resource-providers

revisions:
[{'number': 27, 'created': '2015-10-28 01:36:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_resources.py', 'nova/resources.py'], 'message': 'Adds resource classes

A set of resource classes is added in /nova/resources.py. Simple
integer-based resources like CPU, RAM, and LocalDisk are included, in
addition to complex resources like NUMATopology, which uses the
objects in nova.objects.numa in order to update usage amounts and
calculate whether a requested NUMATopology for a to-be-launched
instance would fit in the NUMA cells advertised and used on a compute
node.

A base nova.resources.Resource class is used as a generic class
interface for any resource, simple or complex, to create concrete
amount and inventory records. The idea here is to have a single way
of modeling some resource that is provided by a compute node, and a
single way of comparing a requested amount of something with
the capacity and usage records of the provider of that resource.

The next patch in the series adds methods to nova.objects.ComputeNode
that allow its resources (RAM, CPU, LocalDisk, PCI devices, NUMA
cells, etc) to be queried as nova.resource.Resource objects.

Change-Id: I72ccdb8c54438d99f131bfb8402dec372fd1460f
Partially-implements: resource-objects
'}]
commit_message:
Adds resource classes

A set of resource classes is added in /nova/resources.py. Simple
integer-based resources like CPU, RAM, and LocalDisk are included, in
addition to complex resources like NUMATopology, which uses the
objects in nova.objects.numa in order to update usage amounts and
calculate whether a requested NUMATopology for a to-be-launched
instance would fit in the NUMA cells advertised and used on a compute
node.

A base nova.resources.Resource class is used as a generic class
interface for any resource, simple or complex, to create concrete
amount and inventory records. The idea here is to have a single way
of modeling some resource that is provided by a compute node, and a
single way of comparing a requested amount of something with
the capacity and usage records of the provider of that resource.

The next patch in the series adds methods to nova.objects.ComputeNode
that allow its resources (RAM, CPU, LocalDisk, PCI devices, NUMA
cells, etc) to be queried as nova.resource.Resource objects.

Change-Id: I72ccdb8c54438d99f131bfb8402dec372fd1460f
Partially-implements: resource-objects

revisions:
[{'number': 28, 'created': '2015-10-28 01:36:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/numa.py', 'nova/objects/resources.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_resources.py', 'nova/objects/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Add object models for comparing resource amounts

Right now, we have 4 distinct ways (!) of comparing resources in
the resource tracker:

- Straight integer amounts stored in top-level key/value pairs in the
  nova.compute.resource_tracker.ResourceTracker.old_resources
  dictionary attribute.
  For example: {"local_gb": X, "local_gb_used": Y}

- NUMA topology amounts and usages are stored as a serialized
  nova.virt.hardware.VirtNUMAInstanceTopology/VirtNUMAHostTopology
  pair in the old_resources dictionary under the 'numa_topology'
  key: {"numa_topology": JSON-BLOB}

- PCI device amounts and usages are separately tracked by the
  nova.compute.resource_tracker.ResourceTracker.pci_tracker object.
  This really is quite silly, and duplicates a ton of comparison
  functionality from both NUMA and the standard integer amount/usage
  stuff. The results of this pci_tracker work is placed into the
  "pci_devices" and "pci_passthrough_devices" (no idea why it was
  necessary to have two keys here...) as a JSON-serialized BLOB of
  information that comes directly from the pci_stats field in the
  compute_nodes table.

- The "extensible resource tracker" places "stuff" into a "stats" key
  in the top-level old_resources dictionary attribute. The "stuff" is
  a collection of free-form, unstructured, and undocumented amount
  information for whatever resource classes happen to be included by
  the deployer.

Just like we have 4 distinct ways of comparing resource amounts, we
have four totally different ways of comparing capacity of a resource
with the used amount of that resource:

- Straight integer amounts are compared using a simple
  `(total - used) >  requested` formula.

- NUMA topology usage records use a set of classes that in the
  `nova.objects.numa` module that enable different usage and cell
  topologies to be compared for fit.

- PCI device resource usages are managed in yet another completely
  different way, using the code in `nova.pci.pci_manager.PciManager`,
  which is a member of the resource tracker's pci_tracker attribute.

- And still yet the extensible resource tracker plugins offer another
  way of calculating and storing usage records: in a JSON blob that is
  passed from one plugin to another, with the plugin expected to
  update the supplied dictionary with a usage record that only it
  understands.

This patch adds the basic object models that will enable us to have a
single interface for comparing resource amounts and usages.  It adds
four new nova.objects object classes in /nova/objects/resources.py
that allow any "amount" of a resource to be specified using the same
generalized class, and any capacity/usage of any resource to be both
updated and check for available room for a requested amount of some
resource -- again, all in a consistent generalized class interface.
The next patch in the series adds the actual resource types that
utilize the Amount and Inventory objects introduced in this patch.

Co-Authored-By: Alexis Lee <alexisl@hp.com>
Change-Id: I0261bf3a252fac657496c62790818d24871678e1
Partially-implements: resource-objects
'}]
commit_message:
Add object models for comparing resource amounts

Right now, we have 4 distinct ways (!) of comparing resources in
the resource tracker:

- Straight integer amounts stored in top-level key/value pairs in the
  nova.compute.resource_tracker.ResourceTracker.old_resources
  dictionary attribute.
  For example: {"local_gb": X, "local_gb_used": Y}

- NUMA topology amounts and usages are stored as a serialized
  nova.virt.hardware.VirtNUMAInstanceTopology/VirtNUMAHostTopology
  pair in the old_resources dictionary under the 'numa_topology'
  key: {"numa_topology": JSON-BLOB}

- PCI device amounts and usages are separately tracked by the
  nova.compute.resource_tracker.ResourceTracker.pci_tracker object.
  This really is quite silly, and duplicates a ton of comparison
  functionality from both NUMA and the standard integer amount/usage
  stuff. The results of this pci_tracker work is placed into the
  "pci_devices" and "pci_passthrough_devices" (no idea why it was
  necessary to have two keys here...) as a JSON-serialized BLOB of
  information that comes directly from the pci_stats field in the
  compute_nodes table.

- The "extensible resource tracker" places "stuff" into a "stats" key
  in the top-level old_resources dictionary attribute. The "stuff" is
  a collection of free-form, unstructured, and undocumented amount
  information for whatever resource classes happen to be included by
  the deployer.

Just like we have 4 distinct ways of comparing resource amounts, we
have four totally different ways of comparing capacity of a resource
with the used amount of that resource:

- Straight integer amounts are compared using a simple
  `(total - used) >  requested` formula.

- NUMA topology usage records use a set of classes that in the
  `nova.objects.numa` module that enable different usage and cell
  topologies to be compared for fit.

- PCI device resource usages are managed in yet another completely
  different way, using the code in `nova.pci.pci_manager.PciManager`,
  which is a member of the resource tracker's pci_tracker attribute.

- And still yet the extensible resource tracker plugins offer another
  way of calculating and storing usage records: in a JSON blob that is
  passed from one plugin to another, with the plugin expected to
  update the supplied dictionary with a usage record that only it
  understands.

This patch adds the basic object models that will enable us to have a
single interface for comparing resource amounts and usages.  It adds
four new nova.objects object classes in /nova/objects/resources.py
that allow any "amount" of a resource to be specified using the same
generalized class, and any capacity/usage of any resource to be both
updated and check for available room for a requested amount of some
resource -- again, all in a consistent generalized class interface.
The next patch in the series adds the actual resource types that
utilize the Amount and Inventory objects introduced in this patch.

Co-Authored-By: Alexis Lee <alexisl@hp.com>
Change-Id: I0261bf3a252fac657496c62790818d24871678e1
Partially-implements: resource-objects

commit_message:
Moved checking repository availability to astute tasks

Checking repositories on availability is long task.
Http request can timeouts, while the task running.
Decided to move checking from http request context to
astute task, which running asynchronously.

Depends-On: I76ed1f0b6413cc94c539d795bbba92f8e9dad50b
Depends-On: I0ccf42fd7ff05d68aa4a4aee426c1c8bfa4daea4
Closes-Bug: #1540346

Change-Id: Iff76af0b0a6573f0f8f779fda4333a3658cccc04

commit_message:
Show transitions initiated by API requests

This updates the state machine diagram and documentation to indicate
which transitions are initiated by API requests versus the ones that
are internally done by the conductor. Stable states are highlighted
a bit.

Change-Id: I1a2de81b14696286f1da47c06374ad235962c849
Closes-Bug: #1527316

commit_message:
Change cluster attributes pop call

cluster.attributes.editable is now MutableDict. MutableDict pop method
doesn't take default value. Method call changed to reflect this
incompability.

Change-Id: Ia2d25b4c0f3000e41958ca016a29842eb76cf196
Partial-bug: 1541005

commit_message:
Add baremetal API tests

This patch set adds Ironic's API:
 PUT /v1/nodes/(node_ident)/states/provision

In order to use inspection feature, make microversion 1.6.

Change-Id: Icf471962ad90621d48c8e4f82b9d9dc38c3d446f

Agent base vendor now supports manual cleaning. In the case of a
clean version mismatch (agent rebooted to a new version after manual
cleaning started), we continue from the current clean step instead

commit_message:
Agent vendor handles manual cleaning

Agent base vendor now supports manual cleaning. In the case of a
clean version mismatch (agent rebooted to a new version after manual
cleaning started), we continue from the current clean step instead
of (in automated cleaning) restarting from the first clean step.

Change-Id: I89726f3b32f96befba9a2e1bee67b2a7cc7eeb57
Partial-Bug: #1526290

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-18 16:32:42.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/neutron/security_groups_driver.py'], 'message': 'Adds security_group_updated method in HyperVSecurityGroupDriver

With the changes introduced in securitygroups_rpc with the
below commit hyperv code breaks.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147713/

Because of this, any changes in the security groups are not applied
by the HyperVSecurityGroupDriver because of a NotImplemented error.

Adds the security_group_updated method as noop in
HyperVSecurityGroupDriver, solving the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1512278

Change-Id: Ia5d6fca3c3a2f827ade850bb43fc7e434e934a22
(cherry picked from commit f432ec44a78c4871a48a669c2aa81b33350ff41a)
'}]
commit_message:
Adds security_group_updated method in HyperVSecurityGroupDriver

With the changes introduced in securitygroups_rpc with the
below commit hyperv code breaks.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147713/

Because of this, any changes in the security groups are not applied
by the HyperVSecurityGroupDriver because of a NotImplemented error.

Adds the security_group_updated method as noop in
HyperVSecurityGroupDriver, solving the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1512278

Change-Id: Ia5d6fca3c3a2f827ade850bb43fc7e434e934a22
(cherry picked from commit f432ec44a78c4871a48a669c2aa81b33350ff41a)

subject: Update nodes-tagging spec
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-12 08:31:22.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/nodes-tagging.rst'], 'message': 'Update nodes-tagging spec

Normalize the tag data structure with a cross-ref table.
The current table structure is going to waste space if the
number of tags * nodes is large, which will affect performance
of the tag search API.

Change-Id: I3e96aae377998a4198cdeee3c9db10585f320f40
'}]
commit_message:
Update nodes-tagging spec

Normalize the tag data structure with a cross-ref table.
The current table structure is going to waste space if the
number of tags * nodes is large, which will affect performance
of the tag search API.

Change-Id: I3e96aae377998a4198cdeee3c9db10585f320f40

commit_message:
Disable clean step 'reset_ilo' for iLO drivers by default

Disable default execution of clean step 'reset_ilo' during automated
cleaning. Resetting of iLO is not required during every invocation
of automated cleaning.

Change-Id: I45a5542c8db339417916c64455eba0fae9c3f44a
Closes-Bug: 1542977

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-05 01:20:08.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/ipmitool.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_ipmitool.py'], 'message': 'Log warning if ipmi_username/ipmi_password missing

Even though an empty ipmi_username and/or ipmi_password is valid, it is
often an error in configuration. Log a warning if either value is
missing.

Add unit tests showing that an unspecified username or an empty string
username are treated the same and will cause no user to be specified.

Add unit tests showing that an unspecified password or an empty string
password are treated the same and will cause a NULL (\0) password to be
used.

Change-Id: I384e210da3216fb9335c4c782d69e606026d4b97
'}]
commit_message:
Log warning if ipmi_username/ipmi_password missing

Even though an empty ipmi_username and/or ipmi_password is valid, it is
often an error in configuration. Log a warning if either value is
missing.

Add unit tests showing that an unspecified username or an empty string
username are treated the same and will cause no user to be specified.

Add unit tests showing that an unspecified password or an empty string
password are treated the same and will cause a NULL (\0) password to be
used.

Change-Id: I384e210da3216fb9335c4c782d69e606026d4b97

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-06 01:36:47.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/tests/test_signal.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/engine/service.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Don't recompute metadata after clearing a user hook

Clearing a user hook is one class of signal that never results in a need to
recalculate the stack metadata, regardless of the resource type.

Change-Id: I555794e6ad3f6ffa43969f37d35766e3556e6fbb
Closes-Bug: #1542455
(cherry picked from commit d98c16fb0cda77ff8cf65769519bef98cce568e9)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't recompute metadata after clearing a user hook

Clearing a user hook is one class of signal that never results in a need to
recalculate the stack metadata, regardless of the resource type.

Change-Id: I555794e6ad3f6ffa43969f37d35766e3556e6fbb
Closes-Bug: #1542455
(cherry picked from commit d98c16fb0cda77ff8cf65769519bef98cce568e9)

commit_message:

It currently does not and it is, obviously, a needed dependency.

commit_message:
Fix incorrect result of listing private template

Previously, it returns all templates belong to tenant when only
requests private templates. The root cause is tenant filter overwrite
is_public filter by mistake. So fixed it and enhanced the test case
to make sure it only return private templates.

Change-Id: I382dd1e368df531898ca5431c85f5755b75bf4a2
Closes-Bug: #1540709

subject: Fix i9n tests broken due to xvfbwrapper update
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-01 19:03:31.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/helpers.py'], 'message': 'Fix i9n tests broken due to xvfbwrapper update

Since version 0.2.8 released on Jan 31 self.vdisplay.xvfb_cmd exists no
more before self.vdisplay.start(), so we need to pass options to
framebuffer in a different way. Attribute extra_xvfb_args should be
used for that.

Closes-Bug: #1540495
Change-Id: I4cd4f20f774ffdba8fd1f80ad2ddc2029712c895
'}]
commit_message:
Fix i9n tests broken due to xvfbwrapper update

Since version 0.2.8 released on Jan 31 self.vdisplay.xvfb_cmd exists no
more before self.vdisplay.start(), so we need to pass options to
framebuffer in a different way. Attribute extra_xvfb_args should be
used for that.

Closes-Bug: #1540495
Change-Id: I4cd4f20f774ffdba8fd1f80ad2ddc2029712c895

commit_message:
Add support for root-disable

Added the route action for disabling the root user in the extensions.

Modified the resource extension to allow the generation of a DELETE
route on the resource itself.

Implemented root-disable on the mysql guest.  Added not implemented
error messages for all other datastores.

Change-Id: I52519b86c47694c554b624d1d2fbe7a001af55fc
Partially implements: blueprint root-disable
Depends-On: I27831eb361c2b219a9623f152b9def73a2865d67

This patch removes a workaround database call that causes old

This patch removes a workaround database call that causes old
data to be pushed to the amphora haproxy configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1542120

commit_message:
Abstract accesses to policy engine

To be easy to switch to the new architecture, API models use an abstracted
class to access Policy Engine. When Congress uses the architecture, set
the distributed_architecture to True. Same abstraction can be used to
accesses between policy engine and datasources, and between API models and
datasources.

This is like POC for the abstraction, it's needed to make tests for the
class for merge.

Change-Id: Ie95cdac193866a107a0cdcba706dab0ad2eee32c
Partially-implements: blueprint dist-api-rpcify-policy

commit_message:
run Puppet OpenStack integration jobs on puppet-ceph

Puppet OpenStack integration jobs deploy Ceph on scenario001 using
openstack/puppet-ceph module.
This patch aims to run integration jobs for puppet-ceph so we can
provide feedback to puppet-ceph group at how the module work in an
OpenStack environment.

Change-Id: I02af643fab760ab983f3a73df086f188d4d82a96

commit_message:
Changed EC backend from jerasure to liberasurecode in examples and docs

liberasurecode_rs_vand is build-in liberasurecode, so you don't need
another depedency libjerasure2.

liberasurecode_rs_vand is supported by pyeclib from 1.0.8
version, so bumping version up.

Closes-Bug: #1534325
Change-Id: If2d96875694df8fd48c5278395859aaa165cb566

commit_message:
Do not use __builtin__ in python3

__builtin__ does not exist in Python 3, use
six.moves.builtins instead.

Change-Id: I58d456669abcbc58c9a3df8f15f24996a71b299b
closes-bug: #1290234

commit_message:
Remove microseconds from apache log(s)

Remove the microseconds from the apache logs and move back to using
milliseconds. There is no longer any 2.2 workarounds in the keystone
setup process.

Change-Id: I8787eee41fbde1f9794aeffe1e862af0d5117bc3

commit_message:
Sync L3Driver, NullL3 interface with LinuxNetL3

Commit 59ac254 added a new positional argument 'is_external' to
the LinuxNetL3.initialize_network method.

Update initialize_network for L3Driver and NullL3 to sync interfaces.
Add a unit test to check that LinuxNetL3 and NullL3 interfaces match
L3Driver interface.

Change-Id: If6f4340a07a4ed7b7c7873a52c97bca38f3ffe48

Make v3 identity_client consistent

identity_client of v3 API was inconsistent and it was against the
pep8 T110 rule. This patch fixes these inconsistencies.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

If you view /admin/images and /project/images, you will see that a long
image name is truncated in /project/images but not /admin/images.  This
commit updates openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/images/tables.py to
truncate the displayed image name to 40 characters, as is currently

commit_message:
Truncate image name in admin/images table

If you view /admin/images and /project/images, you will see that a long
image name is truncated in /project/images but not /admin/images.  This
commit updates openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/images/tables.py to
truncate the displayed image name to 40 characters, as is currently
being done in
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/tables.py.

Change-Id: I68ac044ae57550284d833ad0433b091595819530

As of now reserved quota for the instances which were stuck in
deleting task-state while resizing was in progress, are not updated
accordingly on nova-compute start-up. This is because in present
code if quota delta is negative then reserved quota is not updated
while committing the quota.

instance id. To calculate correct quota delta, it requires latest
migration record.

object commit() method. With this change it is possible to invert the
reserved quota, if delta is negative and invert_quota value is True.

and update the reserved quota if instance was resizing when user has
sent request to delete the instance.

Change-Id: I424e31c39baa4d7c96bb29687cfa45b7a6092e32
Closes-Bug: 1296414

commit_message:
Fix quota-update when nova-compute startup finish

As of now reserved quota for the instances which were stuck in
deleting task-state while resizing was in progress, are not updated
accordingly on nova-compute start-up. This is because in present
code if quota delta is negative then reserved quota is not updated
while committing the quota.

Added new db interface to get latest migration object based on
instance id, as there might be many migration records for the same
instance id. To calculate correct quota delta, it requires latest
migration record.

Added new flag 'invert_quota' which default to False in quotas
object commit() method. With this change it is possible to invert the
reserved quota, if delta is negative and invert_quota value is True.

Added code to pass correct in_use quota to _delete_instance method
and update the reserved quota if instance was resizing when user has
sent request to delete the instance.

Change-Id: I424e31c39baa4d7c96bb29687cfa45b7a6092e32
Closes-Bug: 1296414

Horizon currently uses the OS::Nova::Instance resource type when
querying for instance metadata, but it should use OS::Nova::Server

commit_message:
Use OS::Nova::Server resource type for instance metadata

Horizon currently uses the OS::Nova::Instance resource type when
querying for instance metadata, but it should use OS::Nova::Server
to align with Heat and Searchlight.

See also:
  https://review.openstack.org/272271

Closes-Bug: #1537903
Change-Id: I1deab8ed74515d08301e68bd2c75604d35592c50

commit_message:
IBM XIV/DS8K: Implements Replication V2

This patch implements cinder Replication version 2 as proposed in
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/replication-v2

the changes are:
1. the ability to enable replication on the specified volume
2. the ability to disable replication on the specified volume.
3. the ability to return the list of replication targets for a volume
4. the ability to force failover to a secondary replication target.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint ibm-xiv-ds8k-replication-v2
Change-Id: I04d1db17762fe72add2ab34193946daeca2f88e6

subject: Bump paramiko from 1.13.0 to 1.16.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-17 03:31:57.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump paramiko from 1.13.0 to 1.16.0

The 1.16.0 version of paramiko includes support for sha2. Previous
to this only md5 and sha1 were available for the key exchange.
Those hashes are considered weak and vulnerable whereas sha2 is
not.

Change-Id: I12fae394506ce6f18ca7f438f3eb9e5abe51d901
'}]
commit_message:
Bump paramiko from 1.13.0 to 1.16.0

The 1.16.0 version of paramiko includes support for sha2. Previous
to this only md5 and sha1 were available for the key exchange.
Those hashes are considered weak and vulnerable whereas sha2 is
not.

Change-Id: I12fae394506ce6f18ca7f438f3eb9e5abe51d901

commit_message:
Replace exit() with sys.exit()

The exit() function is added by the site module so that it can be used
in the interactive interpreter. It's use is not recommended in
applications:
https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html#constants-added-by-the-site-module

Co-Authored-By: David Stanek <dstanek@dstanek.com>
Closes-Bug: #1542587
Change-Id: Ic6a1fe7f3925b0efd34111713cc56857757b29cf

subject: Refuse to delete compute service if host is in host aggregate
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-29 10:21:57.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/refuse-to-delete-host-in-aggregate.rst'], 'message': 'Refuse to delete compute service if host is in host aggregate

User need to remove host from host aggregate, before removing the compute
service. Otherwise, host aggreate will deny to remove this host, because
compute service does not exist. And user will not able to delete this host
aggregate either, because it is not empty. This code change prevents user to
remove a compute service, before removing its host from host aggregate.

Change-Id: I1ba2b5242f2c1ceb78e13d8041da26722d2b0b1c
Related-Bug: 1470341
'}]
commit_message:
Refuse to delete compute service if host is in host aggregate

User need to remove host from host aggregate, before removing the compute
service. Otherwise, host aggreate will deny to remove this host, because
compute service does not exist. And user will not able to delete this host
aggregate either, because it is not empty. This code change prevents user to
remove a compute service, before removing its host from host aggregate.

Change-Id: I1ba2b5242f2c1ceb78e13d8041da26722d2b0b1c
Related-Bug: 1470341

groupings to scope policy and quotas.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-15 20:12:53.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/disk-ram-monitor-plugin.rst'], 'message': 'Introduce Disk and Memory Monitor Plugin for Compute

At present to get the actual utilization on the compute only the CPU plugin
in available. There are various occasion when the admin would like to know
the actual utilization of disk and memory on the compute. With this feature
we would like to introduce two new monitor plugins one for disk and other
for memory to report the actual usage statistics. These statistics will be
dumped into nove.compute_nodes tables as part of the metrics column and can
be fetched from the API. Also the scheduler changes to understand these
metrics will be included as part of this feature.

Change-Id: If23caae200deb56afa71421d70965e9817893bfb
Implements: blueprint disk-memory-monitor-plugin
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce Disk and Memory Monitor Plugin for Compute

At present to get the actual utilization on the compute only the CPU plugin
in available. There are various occasion when the admin would like to know
the actual utilization of disk and memory on the compute. With this feature
we would like to introduce two new monitor plugins one for disk and other
for memory to report the actual usage statistics. These statistics will be
dumped into nove.compute_nodes tables as part of the metrics column and can
be fetched from the API. Also the scheduler changes to understand these
metrics will be included as part of this feature.

Change-Id: If23caae200deb56afa71421d70965e9817893bfb
Implements: blueprint disk-memory-monitor-plugin
