subject: Optimize NUMA topology based deploys on PowerPC
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-02 19:33:19.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/numa-optimization-ppc.rst'], 'message': "Optimize NUMA topology based deploys on PowerPC

PowerPC architecture does core based scheduling for processes.
Openstack's libvirt driver presently only does thread based
cpu scheduling. The same libvirt driver is used in case of
PowerPC based systems as well.

This spec attempts to optimize the use cases w.r.t
NUMA cell affinity and dedicated cpu pinning for PowerPC.

Change-Id: I3994e6fcbb4648424f405194e0f9fff26c176956
Blueprint: numa-optimization-ppc
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize NUMA topology based deploys on PowerPC

PowerPC architecture does core based scheduling for processes.
Openstack's libvirt driver presently only does thread based
cpu scheduling. The same libvirt driver is used in case of
PowerPC based systems as well.

This spec attempts to optimize the use cases w.r.t
NUMA cell affinity and dedicated cpu pinning for PowerPC.

Change-Id: I3994e6fcbb4648424f405194e0f9fff26c176956
Blueprint: numa-optimization-ppc

commit_message:
Add volume type to create server API

Currently in create server API, using block_device_mapping
parameter can create cinder volume and attach to instance, but there
aren't volume type parameter to create a SLA based volume, so
this bp will add the volume type to create api.

Change-Id: I990875f0d5d9d892c38982455b021e5a6261464b
Blueprint: enable-volume-types

subject: Speed up functional testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 15:57:44.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/tests.py'], 'message': "Speed up functional testing

test/functional/tests.py:TestObjectVersioningUTF8 does not clean
up the versions files it creates because the class's multiple
inheritance is such that it does not call the tearDown method in
TestObjectVersioning.

As a result, any attempt to clean up account containers wastes
time retrying container delete requests. This occurs either in
the setUp for TestSloEnv, if the TestSlo class is included in a
test run, or in the tests.py package tearDown method.

On the author's dev machine this patch reduces the execution
time of functional tests in tests.py by approx 30% or 1 minute.

Change-Id: I8194672bf2ca82435df5868720b6a55a79b94413
"}]
commit_message:
Speed up functional testing

test/functional/tests.py:TestObjectVersioningUTF8 does not clean
up the versions files it creates because the class's multiple
inheritance is such that it does not call the tearDown method in
TestObjectVersioning.

As a result, any attempt to clean up account containers wastes
time retrying container delete requests. This occurs either in
the setUp for TestSloEnv, if the TestSlo class is included in a
test run, or in the tests.py package tearDown method.

On the author's dev machine this patch reduces the execution
time of functional tests in tests.py by approx 30% or 1 minute.

Change-Id: I8194672bf2ca82435df5868720b6a55a79b94413

commit_message:
Duplicate location error should raise HTTPConflict

Now, when add or replace a duplicate location to an image, Glance
will rasie 400 HTTPBadRequest error, which is not correct. It should
raise 409 HTTPConflict to keep the same with Glance client.
The artifacts raise 400 as well.

APIimpact
Docimpact

Change-Id: I59fc7ced5cb717884bf9668359986e681af6e1f6
Closes-bug: #1520053

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-24 14:02:05.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/libvirt-emulator-threads-policy.rst'], 'message': 'Libvirt driver emulator threads placement policy

The Nova schedular determines CPU resource utilization and instance
CPU placement based on the number of vCPUs in the flavour. A number
of hypervisors have work that is performed in the host OS on behalf
of a guest instance, which does not take place in association with
a vCPU. This is currently unaccounted for in Nova scheduling and
cannot have any placement policy controls applied.

Change-Id: Ie3309323334e20b0b7104a69217aa622b46fa627
Blueprint: libvirt-emulator-threads-policy
'}]
commit_message:
Libvirt driver emulator threads placement policy

The Nova schedular determines CPU resource utilization and instance
CPU placement based on the number of vCPUs in the flavour. A number
of hypervisors have work that is performed in the host OS on behalf
of a guest instance, which does not take place in association with
a vCPU. This is currently unaccounted for in Nova scheduling and
cannot have any placement policy controls applied.

Change-Id: Ie3309323334e20b0b7104a69217aa622b46fa627
Blueprint: libvirt-emulator-threads-policy

subject: Volume support for multi hypervisors
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6984, 'name': 'Sébastien Han', 'email': 'seb@redhat.com', 'username': 'leseb'}, {'_account_id': 9066, 'name': 'Satoru Moriya', 'email': 'satoru.moriya.br@hitachi.com', 'username': 'satoru-moriya-br'}, {'_account_id': 9174, 'name': 'Seiji Aguchi', 'email': 'seiji.aguchi.tr@hitachi.com', 'username': 'saguchi'}, {'_account_id': 9176, 'name': 'Tomoki Sekiyama', 'email': 'tomoki.sekiyama@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsekiyama'}, {'_account_id': 10115, 'name': 'Mitsuhiro Tanino', 'email': 'mittjp1129@gmail.com', 'username': 'mtanino'}, {'_account_id': 16373, 'name': 'Kazumasa Nomura', 'email': 'kazumasa.nomura.rx@hitachi.com', 'username': 'knomura'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-01 15:32:14.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/volume-support-for-multi-hypervisors.rst'], 'message': "Volume support for multi hypervisors

In multi hypervisor OpenStack environment using such as
KVM, VMware, Hyper-V etc, we need to provide Cinder storage
backends corresponding to these hypervisors for booting an
instance from a volume. For example, VMware needs VMDK Cinder
backend, Hyper-V needs Windows Cinder backend and also KVM needs
supported backends such as LVM, ceph etc. KVM can't boot from
VMDK backend.

However, there is no way to specify storage backend when we boot
an instance from a volume. As a result, the boot volume might be
created on unrelated backend then the volume boot will fail.

To boot an instance from specific combination between hypervisor
and storage backend, Nova should pass hypervisor_type as a hint
of Cinder filter scheduler when Nova creates a new volume for
attaching the instance.

Blueprint: volume-support-for-multi-hypervisors
Change-Id: I887952f5b14f8fb3b4bffac7fffd311725d90aad
"}]
commit_message:
Volume support for multi hypervisors

In multi hypervisor OpenStack environment using such as
KVM, VMware, Hyper-V etc, we need to provide Cinder storage
backends corresponding to these hypervisors for booting an
instance from a volume. For example, VMware needs VMDK Cinder
backend, Hyper-V needs Windows Cinder backend and also KVM needs
supported backends such as LVM, ceph etc. KVM can't boot from
VMDK backend.

However, there is no way to specify storage backend when we boot
an instance from a volume. As a result, the boot volume might be
created on unrelated backend then the volume boot will fail.

To boot an instance from specific combination between hypervisor
and storage backend, Nova should pass hypervisor_type as a hint
of Cinder filter scheduler when Nova creates a new volume for
attaching the instance.

Blueprint: volume-support-for-multi-hypervisors
Change-Id: I887952f5b14f8fb3b4bffac7fffd311725d90aad

commit_message:
Add a binding type negotiation between Nova and Neutron

Change the Nova-Neutron interface in a backward compatible way so that
Neutron ports are bound using Nova's expressed preference of APIs.

This allows Neutron to select the appropriate binding_type according
to its abilities and the preference of supporting hypervisor
drivers.

Change-Id: Iad1c76240680d8415a0f433483cc8b33817382ae

limits flexibility when experimenting with new designs. This spec calls
for changing that to a configurable option.

subject: [WIP] SSH host certificates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-25 06:29:19.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/ssh-host-certificates.rst'], 'message': "[WIP] SSH host certificates

RFC:

While the idea is possible to implement and will work, there's a problem
of secure host key storage left. The host keys should not be permamently
available in nova's database.

The most trivial way to achieve it would be to periodically clean host
keys created X minutes ago. (so certainly after the host booted and had
the chance to copy it) Another option would be to make the metadata
writable/erasable, but that's going against the current design.

Yet another option would be to only allow host key signing where direct
access to the spawned instance is available before boot (libguestfs,
etc.) This has the extra benefit of not preserving the key in the
database at all.

Suggestions, alternatives and comments on the rest of the spec welcome.

Change-Id: Ie56634789ba3ac92f9a59110bc66d37f1a7c74dd
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] SSH host certificates

RFC:

While the idea is possible to implement and will work, there's a problem
of secure host key storage left. The host keys should not be permamently
available in nova's database.

The most trivial way to achieve it would be to periodically clean host
keys created X minutes ago. (so certainly after the host booted and had
the chance to copy it) Another option would be to make the metadata
writable/erasable, but that's going against the current design.

Yet another option would be to only allow host key signing where direct
access to the spawned instance is available before boot (libguestfs,
etc.) This has the extra benefit of not preserving the key in the
database at all.

Suggestions, alternatives and comments on the rest of the spec welcome.

Change-Id: Ie56634789ba3ac92f9a59110bc66d37f1a7c74dd

commit_message:
Support hypervisor_type option

Glance supports metadata to specify a hypervisor corresponding
to a glance image, but as a result, we should prepare multiple
images as many as hypervisors even if the images are almost same.

Supporting hypervior_type parameter through flavor extra-specs
could solve this problem.

Change-Id: I52c9f9912488a047a180711c071900aa2d497e17
Implements: blueprint support-hypervisor-type-option

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-10-21 05:52:36.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/libvirt-imagebackend-clvm.rst'], 'message': "Add Clustered LVM support to Libvirt LVM image backend

Nova libvirt driver supports LVM as its image backend and it can
also be used for Clustered LVM (CLVM). CLVM is an extended version
of Linux LVM2 on top of SAN storages to support concurrent access
from servers. To do so, it is based on clustering software like
Pacemaker/Corosync, DLM (Linux distributed lock manager) and
clvmd to share LVM metadata among servers safely. It's useful to
support VM live-migration between compute hosts sharing a CLVM pool.

The goal of this spec is to support live-migration on CLVM.

bp libvirt-imagebackend-clvm

Change-Id: I1ee85d744c20da126cc2494114c7144a4da12d6e
"}]
commit_message:
Add Clustered LVM support to Libvirt LVM image backend

Nova libvirt driver supports LVM as its image backend and it can
also be used for Clustered LVM (CLVM). CLVM is an extended version
of Linux LVM2 on top of SAN storages to support concurrent access
from servers. To do so, it is based on clustering software like
Pacemaker/Corosync, DLM (Linux distributed lock manager) and
clvmd to share LVM metadata among servers safely. It's useful to
support VM live-migration between compute hosts sharing a CLVM pool.

The goal of this spec is to support live-migration on CLVM.

bp libvirt-imagebackend-clvm

Change-Id: I1ee85d744c20da126cc2494114c7144a4da12d6e

This was approved for liberty but code was never submitted.  I emailed

Spec for blueprint refresh-quotas-usage

commit_message:
Re-propose spec for refresh-quotas-usage

This was approved for liberty but code was never submitted.  I emailed
Romain and he said he wouldn't have time to work on it in Mitaka.
However, this was something that many operators expressed interest in
before so it seems valuable and straight-forward to try again on this in
Mitaka.

There are two changes from the original spec:

1. --user is optional with the quota_usage_refresh command.

2. The testing section is updated to point out that unit and functional
   tests would be provided.

Previously-approved: liberty

Spec for blueprint refresh-quotas-usage

Originally authored by: Romain Hardouin <romain.hardouin@cloudwatt.com>

Change-Id: Idbb571c2b953d8cf9e9b98496bb584d6ca931272

commit_message:
Fix invalid import order

Updated import order as per the OpenStack import standards [1].
Modules under magnum/common/pythonk8sclient are not covered in
this patch because this code is generated via a third party
tool "swagger-codegen" which does not follows openstack
standards yet.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#import-order-template

Change-Id: Ia87f3e797ee627bf3c04d2bae9639fd305b41b0d

commit_message:
Fix Create Image angularjs code

This code intended to allow pre-filling of the form values through
Django's handling of GET parameters, but it did not do so as the
code was incorrect. This was not previously noticed as the angularjs
code wasn't actually being executed. Once it was, it broke. Ironic,
I know.

Change-Id: I8d641de9246fd4f43c96bf85d47bb648f4401def
Closes-Bug: 1503396

subject: glusterfs/volume layout: indicate volume usage on volumes themselves
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 8851, 'name': 'Valeriy Ponomaryov', 'email': 'kiparis.kh@gmail.com', 'username': 'vponomaryov'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 17623, 'name': 'Hitachi Manila HNAS CI', 'email': 'OpenstackManilaCI@hds.com', 'username': 'Hitachi-Manila-HNAS-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18128, 'name': 'Microsoft Manila CI', 'email': 'Microsoft_Manila_CI@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_manila_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-21 16:38:16.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/glusterfs/test_layout_volume.py', 'manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/layout_volume.py'], 'message': "glusterfs/volume layout: indicate volume usage on volumes themselves

With volume layout, share-volume association was kept solely
in the manila DB. That is not robust enough, first and
foremost because upon starting the service, the manager
will indicate existing share associations only of those
volumes whose shares is in 'available' state.

We need to know though if a volume is in a pristine state or
not, regardless of the state of their shares. To this end,
we introduce the 'user.manila-share' GlusterFS volume option
to indicate manila share association -- made possible by
GlusterFS allowing any user defined option to exist in the
'user' option name space --, which indicator remains there
until we explicitely drop it in `delete_share`. (The value
of 'user.manila-share' is the id of the share owning the
volume).

As a beneficial side effect, this change will also provide
insight to the Gluster storage admin about usage of the
Manila volume pool.

Change-Id: Icb388fd31fb6a992bee7e731f5e84403d5fd1a85
Partial-Bug: #1501670
(cherry picked from commit 3537be25165e96a44254b66f13ea508f60f57af0)
"}]
commit_message:
glusterfs/volume layout: indicate volume usage on volumes themselves

With volume layout, share-volume association was kept solely
in the manila DB. That is not robust enough, first and
foremost because upon starting the service, the manager
will indicate existing share associations only of those
volumes whose shares is in 'available' state.

We need to know though if a volume is in a pristine state or
not, regardless of the state of their shares. To this end,
we introduce the 'user.manila-share' GlusterFS volume option
to indicate manila share association -- made possible by
GlusterFS allowing any user defined option to exist in the
'user' option name space --, which indicator remains there
until we explicitely drop it in `delete_share`. (The value
of 'user.manila-share' is the id of the share owning the
volume).

As a beneficial side effect, this change will also provide
insight to the Gluster storage admin about usage of the
Manila volume pool.

Change-Id: Icb388fd31fb6a992bee7e731f5e84403d5fd1a85
Partial-Bug: #1501670
(cherry picked from commit 3537be25165e96a44254b66f13ea508f60f57af0)

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-01-26 22:40:16.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/tests/test_coordination.py', 'tooz/drivers/etcd.py', 'tooz/locking.py', 'tooz/drivers/ipc.py', 'tooz/drivers/memcached.py', 'tooz/drivers/redis.py'], 'message': 'Add lock breaking

Lock breaking (which breaks the lock forcefully) is
useful for testing other features in tooz that need
to handle a lock being broken (or owned by someone
else) after they were initially acquired so adding
it will be quite useful going forward (for tooz

Co-Authored-By: Clint Byrum <clint@fewbar.com>

Change-Id: Icd17f57045c5642d81bb643a846ceb4fb6859f0e
'}]
commit_message:
Add lock breaking

Lock breaking (which breaks the lock forcefully) is
useful for testing other features in tooz that need
to handle a lock being broken (or owned by someone
else) after they were initially acquired so adding
it will be quite useful going forward (for tooz
and users of tooz).

Co-Authored-By: Clint Byrum <clint@fewbar.com>

Change-Id: Icd17f57045c5642d81bb643a846ceb4fb6859f0e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-06 09:50:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_availability_zone.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_extension_driver_api.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "ML2: Call _dict_extend in create_(net|port) ops

The extensions fields were not being added to the response being
sent back to the user for ports and networks that weren't from
ML2 extensions (e.g. availability zones). This created an
inconsistent response between creates and updates/gets. It also
resulted in incomplete data in the AMQP create notification emitted
in the API layer.

This patch adjusts ML2 to call the _apply_dict_extend_functions
method after creating ports and networks. To make this work, another
DB lookup to get the latest model state was necessary. However, this
is part of an already expensive operation (create) so the performance
impact should be minimal.

This issue stems from the fact that db_base_plugin_v2 does not
process extensions when its create_port, create_network methods
are called. This original skipping behavior was added back in
patch If0f0277191884aab4dcb1ee36826df7f7d66a8fa as a performance
improvement to deal with dictionary extension functions that
performed DB lookups. However, at this point the dictionary
extension functions should have been optimized to skip any DB
lookups to avoid the massive performance penalties they incur
during list operations.

An alternative to this patch was to adjust the db_base_plugin_v2
to stop skipping extensions. However, because this is usually
called by inheriting plugins before they process extensions
for the new port/network, the extensions do not yet have the
required information to extend the dict and will fail. So each
core plugin will need to apply similar logic to support extensions
that rely on the extend_dict functions.

Closes-Bug: #1541774
Change-Id: Iea2c0e7f9ee5eeae28b99797874ca8a8e5790ec2
"}]
commit_message:
ML2: Call _dict_extend in create_(net|port) ops

The extensions fields were not being added to the response being
sent back to the user for ports and networks that weren't from
ML2 extensions (e.g. availability zones). This created an
inconsistent response between creates and updates/gets. It also
resulted in incomplete data in the AMQP create notification emitted
in the API layer.

This patch adjusts ML2 to call the _apply_dict_extend_functions
method after creating ports and networks. To make this work, another
DB lookup to get the latest model state was necessary. However, this
is part of an already expensive operation (create) so the performance
impact should be minimal.

This issue stems from the fact that db_base_plugin_v2 does not
process extensions when its create_port, create_network methods
are called. This original skipping behavior was added back in
patch If0f0277191884aab4dcb1ee36826df7f7d66a8fa as a performance
improvement to deal with dictionary extension functions that
performed DB lookups. However, at this point the dictionary
extension functions should have been optimized to skip any DB
lookups to avoid the massive performance penalties they incur
during list operations.

An alternative to this patch was to adjust the db_base_plugin_v2
to stop skipping extensions. However, because this is usually
called by inheriting plugins before they process extensions
for the new port/network, the extensions do not yet have the
required information to extend the dict and will fail. So each
core plugin will need to apply similar logic to support extensions
that rely on the extend_dict functions.

Closes-Bug: #1541774
Change-Id: Iea2c0e7f9ee5eeae28b99797874ca8a8e5790ec2

subject: Sort osc command entry points
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 22:28:38.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Sort osc command entry points

Due to the number of reviews adding new commands to setup.cfg
openstack.orchestration.v1, most of these reviews have merge conflicts
because they append to the openstack.orchestration.v1 list.

This change sorts the list. There will be less merge conflicts if all
osc changes are rebased so that they maintain this sorting, which will
allow the changes to land faster.

Change-Id: I834df989e7175dc49098e4a281b5e2afde21fdb1
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient
'}]
commit_message:
Sort osc command entry points

Due to the number of reviews adding new commands to setup.cfg
openstack.orchestration.v1, most of these reviews have merge conflicts
because they append to the openstack.orchestration.v1 list.

This change sorts the list. There will be less merge conflicts if all
osc changes are rebased so that they maintain this sorting, which will
allow the changes to land faster.

Change-Id: I834df989e7175dc49098e4a281b5e2afde21fdb1
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient

subject: Modify update user info from pencil icon in keystone v2
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-08 00:30:15.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/keystone.py'], 'message': "Modify update user info from pencil icon in keystone v2

When we update the user info from pencil icon in User List,
data doesn't have 'project' attribute.
Therefore, date.pop('project') failed and exception occur.

The v2 API updates user model and default project separately.
And in User List, operator don't need to consider if a user
have a default tenant.
So we should check if data has a 'project' attribute and
if data has no 'project' attribute, it will update only user info.

Change-Id: I979bedeb8ddb15d3f7f171660ec9df4875edb53a
Closes-Bug: #1523343
"}]
commit_message:
Modify update user info from pencil icon in keystone v2

When we update the user info from pencil icon in User List,
data doesn't have 'project' attribute.
Therefore, date.pop('project') failed and exception occur.

The v2 API updates user model and default project separately.
And in User List, operator don't need to consider if a user
have a default tenant.
So we should check if data has a 'project' attribute and
if data has no 'project' attribute, it will update only user info.

Change-Id: I979bedeb8ddb15d3f7f171660ec9df4875edb53a
Closes-Bug: #1523343

commit_message:
Make add_tap_interface resillient to removal

This patch makes add_tap_interface safe to race conditions
where the interface is removed in the middle of processing
by catching exceptions and checking to see if the interface
still exists. If it no longer exists it assumes the exception
was caused by the missing interface and returns False as it
would if the interface did not exist to begin with.

Change-Id: Ie0d89fc2584490b6985aee66da70bae027a130ed
Closes-bug: #1542972

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6577, 'name': 'Sergey Kraynev', 'email': 'sergejyit@gmail.com', 'username': 'skraynev'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 16203, 'name': 'zengyingzhe', 'email': 'zengyingzhe@huawei.com', 'username': 'zengyingzhe'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-04 00:51:16.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_provider_template.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py'], 'message': 'Use TemplateResource._stack_kwargs in _needs_update

This change does the following:
- TemplateResource _needs_update now compares stack update kwargs and
  performs no update if the arguments are identical
- TemplateResource _needs_update falls back to return True if prev_resource
  is not supplied

This avoids calling stack-update on nested stacks with no changes. On a 2 node
tripleo overcloud this results in a stack update going from 4 minutes to 2
minutes. Most of the remaining 2 minutes will be the time taken for the puppet
runs.

Change-Id: I364c0f80c36b024d4aff3150c1ca0bad2a14cae3
Closes-Bug: #1539362
'}]
commit_message:
Use TemplateResource._stack_kwargs in _needs_update

This change does the following:
- TemplateResource _needs_update now compares stack update kwargs and
  performs no update if the arguments are identical
- TemplateResource _needs_update falls back to return True if prev_resource
  is not supplied

This avoids calling stack-update on nested stacks with no changes. On a 2 node
tripleo overcloud this results in a stack update going from 4 minutes to 2
minutes. Most of the remaining 2 minutes will be the time taken for the puppet
runs.

Change-Id: I364c0f80c36b024d4aff3150c1ca0bad2a14cae3
Closes-Bug: #1539362

commit_message:
Remove Xtrabackup from Galera client role

Carrying Xtrabackup as a hard dependency across all hosts acting as a client
of the cluster is unnecessary, as it is only required on the Galera server cluster
members themselves.

Change-Id: I2fa0e862e3a9ad73c6391969564891d913273a79

commit_message:
Handle bad Swift endpoint in guest_log

The guest log code raises a non-serializable exception if the given
Swift endpoint is invalid. This causes an ambiguous "Circular
reference detected" error on the guest, and a timeout on the caller.

This case is now caught and the correct exception raised.

Closes bug: 1542038
Change-Id: I3e84f7ae5cd1d2034cf681776addf797fd4410f5

commit_message:
LVM driver: Pass '--units g' to vgs invocation

This fixes an issue where "large" volume groups are reported with a VSize
in 't' units and thus throw an IndexError in the applied regex match.

Change-Id: If8d7ced15e9739baeb2aed280d3e8ff3503b16fe
Closes-Bug: 1542054

subject: Align nova-neutron configuration for keystone v3
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-08 19:16:58.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_network_neutron_spec.rb', 'manifests/network/neutron.pp'], 'message': "Align nova-neutron configuration for keystone v3

A recent change in Nova enforced end-users to configure neutron
notifications using Keystone v3 API.

This patch:

* deprecates neutron_default_tenant_id.
  Switch default to 'undef' but still allow to configure the value
  for backward compatibility.
* rename neutron_tenant_name to neutron_project_name. This is not
  backward compatible within Mitaka cycle, but it is between Liberty &
  Mitaka.
* Add 2 new domain-related parameters: neutron_user_domain_name and
  neutron_project_domain_name, both defaults to 'Default'.
* Add /v3 for neutron_auth_url parameter. It's now required in Nova.
  The parameter can still be changed if users want to run v2 (before
  Mitaka) but it will break at some point.

Co-Authored-By: David Moreau Simard <dms@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I1a99a050ba70399f045930e26e52719bb53a75b3
Related-Bug: #1542486
"}]
commit_message:
Align nova-neutron configuration for keystone v3

A recent change in Nova enforced end-users to configure neutron
notifications using Keystone v3 API.

This patch:

* deprecates neutron_default_tenant_id.
  Switch default to 'undef' but still allow to configure the value
  for backward compatibility.
* rename neutron_tenant_name to neutron_project_name. This is not
  backward compatible within Mitaka cycle, but it is between Liberty &
  Mitaka.
* Add 2 new domain-related parameters: neutron_user_domain_name and
  neutron_project_domain_name, both defaults to 'Default'.
* Add /v3 for neutron_auth_url parameter. It's now required in Nova.
  The parameter can still be changed if users want to run v2 (before
  Mitaka) but it will break at some point.

Co-Authored-By: David Moreau Simard <dms@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

subject: Adjust api-paste pipeline to work with keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-04 23:03:07.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/api.pp', 'spec/classes/gnocchi_api_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Adjust api-paste pipeline to work with keystone

"keystone_authtoken gnocchi" no longer works against the latest
version of gnocchi. It now requires to be "gnocchi+auth".

Change-Id: Icf4a4b38fbba4fd2e4a20c7c3ffeacf1cc86085e
Closes-Bug: #1542069
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust api-paste pipeline to work with keystone

"keystone_authtoken gnocchi" no longer works against the latest
version of gnocchi. It now requires to be "gnocchi+auth".

Change-Id: Icf4a4b38fbba4fd2e4a20c7c3ffeacf1cc86085e
Closes-Bug: #1542069

revisions:

This is a stash between 2 patches, that need to land together:

latest Nova & Gnocchi, that contains some importants changes.

2/ Update nova.pp with new parameters for Neutron / Nova communications
Related-Bug: #1542486
Depends-On: I1a99a050ba70399f045930e26e52719bb53a75b3

Change-Id: Idc14417cc09ee4ec58b343e57d67b0bd2efeecf2
'}]
commit_message:
Bump RDO packaging and update nova.conf on RedHat systems

This is a stash between 2 patches, that need to land together:

1/ Bump RDO packaging to a very recent Mitaka repo URL so we can have
latest Nova & Gnocchi, that contains some importants changes.
Related-Bug: #1542069
Depends-On: Icf4a4b38fbba4fd2e4a20c7c3ffeacf1cc86085e

2/ Update nova.pp with new parameters for Neutron / Nova communications
Related-Bug: #1542486
Depends-On: I1a99a050ba70399f045930e26e52719bb53a75b3

Change-Id: Idc14417cc09ee4ec58b343e57d67b0bd2efeecf2

commit_message:
'material' checkmark is visible in responsive menu

In a recent regression, the selection checkmark for the
context-picker in 'material' is no longer visible in the responsive
menu because its the same color as the menu background.

Change-Id: I893e33fd23522330afe4971a5f3ca12bcb4fcbb0
Closes-bug: #1539963

commit_message:
Reduce spec parsing in workflow lifecycle

During workflow creation and execution, its specification is parsed
multiple times uselessly. This reduces the load by simply passing around
the specification when it's available.

Change-Id: I5babdbf8e9bc0cf7f69cf724bc7f6b0b270d1667
Closes-Bug: #1541786

subject: Switch simple-init to pip-and-virtualenv element
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-08 05:58:27.000000000', 'files': ['elements/simple-init/element-deps', 'elements/simple-init/package-installs.yaml'], 'message': 'Switch simple-init to pip-and-virtualenv element

We currently install pip from package in the simple-init element.
We should really allow users to select whether to install pip from
git or package.

Change-Id: Ia5e62b9635af90d81227274a1dd8f20474cdbf73
'}]
commit_message:
Switch simple-init to pip-and-virtualenv element

We currently install pip from package in the simple-init element.
We should really allow users to select whether to install pip from
git or package.

Change-Id: Ia5e62b9635af90d81227274a1dd8f20474cdbf73

commit_message:
Function to upload OpenWRT image during Tacker devstack installation

Adding this function will automatically download
the openwrt image and upload it to glance when the tacker plugin
is enabled in the local.conf file.

Change-Id: Ib56baff820104bf5a26d882f2ff8e12a18a44d7f
Closes-Bug: #1517672

commit_message:
Ext. exception handling for httplib and socket errors in Quobyte driver

This extends exception handling of socket.error and
http_client.HTTPException issues to be more verbose. Current handling
drops some exception information. This should help improve the
currently bad reliability of the Quobyte Manila CI.

Closes-Bug: 1520496

Change-Id: Ifccf993c95817e2edffee98777e58b843db45b88

commit_message:
Experimental jobs for testing against oslo.* from master - Take #2

In I82ef7a5d5a3c1076efbd4306b7099cd28960cd90, we added periodic jobs
for Nova to test py27 and py34 tox targets against oslo.* from master
branch on a daily basis. In this review we are expanding the set to
some more projects that oslo releases tend to break :)

Change-Id: Ibdfc03f27450a5392acc276f98bfb464f9a0f663

subject: Bump up eventlet to at least 0.18.1
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-03 00:42:48.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump up eventlet to at least 0.18.1

The eventlet version starting with 0.18.0 has a fix
that allows for running the evenlet backdoor off of
a local unix domain socket (which can be made more secure
than a random local port).

The fix is at:

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/24d283cfd

Said functionality would be nice to have so that
oslo_service can provide that backdoor over a more secureable
channel (one that does not lose the concept of unix
users/groups).

Change-Id: Ia2385879e09991102f8f305ec41dbb651a4374de
'}]
commit_message:
Bump up eventlet to at least 0.18.1

The eventlet version starting with 0.18.0 has a fix
that allows for running the evenlet backdoor off of
a local unix domain socket (which can be made more secure
than a random local port).

The fix is at:

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/24d283cfd

Said functionality would be nice to have so that
oslo_service can provide that backdoor over a more secureable
channel (one that does not lose the concept of unix
users/groups).

Change-Id: Ia2385879e09991102f8f305ec41dbb651a4374de

subject: Revert "Fix for ssl context wrapper spam", add warning filter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 17:33:38.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'octavia/amphorae/drivers/haproxy/rest_api_driver.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Fix for ssl context wrapper spam", add warning filter

Original fix merged before global-requirements were updated, because
requirements weren't being checked accurately. It now looks like
ndg-httpsclient will not be added to global-requirements, and the
warning in question doesn't affect us, so roll back the original fix and
simply squelch the warning.

Global-requirements checks are temporarily disabled on our project until
we fix our requirements to match, so we should get this done ASAP.

This reverts commit 2c2be96a10d94ba4fcc48a96e04589d3ec273b97.

Change-Id: I8e77624fa9558f0596938c16fe4c5a880d56316c
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix for ssl context wrapper spam", add warning filter

Original fix merged before global-requirements were updated, because
requirements weren't being checked accurately. It now looks like
ndg-httpsclient will not be added to global-requirements, and the
warning in question doesn't affect us, so roll back the original fix and
simply squelch the warning.

Global-requirements checks are temporarily disabled on our project until
we fix our requirements to match, so we should get this done ASAP.

This reverts commit 2c2be96a10d94ba4fcc48a96e04589d3ec273b97.

commit_message:
LB agent: Downgrade network not available message

This message will occur whenever a network delete is received
from the server that the agent hasn't setup. It's not an error
condition.

Change-Id: Iacc7915363818973c42bbf55ad48a275713ff338

python-ldap calls out to openldap which can handle multiple URLs for
ldap servers (for the purpose of high availability). openldap expects
these urls to be separated by a comma or whitespace.

Change the help text to specify a comma separated list of URLs is

commit_message:
Support multiple URLs for LDAP server

python-ldap calls out to openldap which can handle multiple URLs for
ldap servers (for the purpose of high availability). openldap expects
these urls to be separated by a comma or whitespace.

Change the help text to specify a comma separated list of URLs is
allowed.

Change-Id: I523dcfc1701a6f7c725c4aa11482bfc15a3515a5
Closes-Bug: #1500631

subject: Spec to reorganize the UI into tabs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-19 20:22:57.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/reduce-number-of-dashboard-panels.rst'], 'message': 'Spec to reorganize the UI into tabs

This spec is to convert the 10 panel approach in
the sahara UI down to 2 panels that will each contain
several tabs.  One tab for each of the current panels.
It represents a significant reorganization of the layout
of the UI and should be a good step forward in terms
of usability.

Change-Id: Ia463b26c5ddf39dcc1cba3da54b7bee479953e0b
'}]
commit_message:
Spec to reorganize the UI into tabs

This spec is to convert the 10 panel approach in
the sahara UI down to 2 panels that will each contain
several tabs.  One tab for each of the current panels.
It represents a significant reorganization of the layout
of the UI and should be a good step forward in terms
of usability.

Change-Id: Ia463b26c5ddf39dcc1cba3da54b7bee479953e0b

commit_message:
Translate all properties during update

This adds a translate call for before properties during update, so that
we can retrive the proper keys when checking them in new resources. This
also handles the network key in the Port resource to not update if
network happens to be in the changed properties.

Change-Id: I4d76b5f60f454babbe60832d9e81912c13d53b9c
Closes-Bug: #1541516
(cherry picked from commit f0775c8d97af832583225c443726fd7ff8d73b8d)

Not all yum failures has to be considered

function should implement the same behavior in Fedora,

Change-Id: I93e9f312a94aeb086925e069a83ec1d3d3419423

commit_message:
Don't die when yum fails.

Not all yum failures has to be considered
catastrofic failures also because install_package
function should implement the same behavior in Fedora,
CentOS and Ubuntu. Let return the error to be solved at higher
level.

Change-Id: I93e9f312a94aeb086925e069a83ec1d3d3419423
Closes-Bug: #1522590

subject: Updating JS unit test coverage threshold
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-05 14:47:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/karma.conf.js', 'horizon/karma.conf.js'], 'message': "Updating JS unit test coverage threshold

This patch updates the JS unit test coverage threshold.  As we've added
code we've increased the coverage.  To keep new code well-covered, we
should increase the threshold so new code doesn't decrease the overall
coverage.  The rule of thumb is to keep it at the highest whole percentage
point that greater than .5% of a difference from the current coverage.

Change-Id: I89e18841b4e9ba4a2cbd49ee222d3234e9d26c88
"}]
commit_message:
Updating JS unit test coverage threshold

This patch updates the JS unit test coverage threshold.  As we've added
code we've increased the coverage.  To keep new code well-covered, we
should increase the threshold so new code doesn't decrease the overall
coverage.  The rule of thumb is to keep it at the highest whole percentage
point that greater than .5% of a difference from the current coverage.

Change-Id: I89e18841b4e9ba4a2cbd49ee222d3234e9d26c88

commit_message:
Fixes a language issue in a release note

This change was raised as a nit in the original review. The original
language implies that the option is only used once. The examples show
that the option is used for each notification to ignore.

commit_message:
Adds a parameter to specify endpoint type

When getting a service catalog from keystone there might be
multiple endpoint types. Adds new parameters to specify
the endpoint type to use in each of the new neutron/nova
groups.

Nova config attributes are removed as the endpoint would be retrieved
from the service catalog with respective endpoint_type and corresponding
roles would define nova access.

CONFIG is added as needed and cfg being removed.

Change-Id: Ie01bd6967eb2003dbe4f7a11ffe8e20a16aa83f5

commit_message:
Port over pretty_tox.sh from Nova

Nova has a bash script that uses the ostestr package to format
the output from tox in a 'pretty' format.  It makes it much more
readable.  pretty_tox.sh is pulled from Nova as-is and enabled
in tox.ini.

Change-Id: Ib90791b1333044c98e20444953d7ccab21cd62ba

subject: Remove redundant config push in CheckBoot()
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-04 18:32:05.000000000', 'files': ['astara/instance_manager.py', 'astara/state.py', 'astara/test/unit/test_state.py', 'astara/test/unit/test_instance_manager.py'], 'message': "Remove redundant config push in CheckBoot()

The CheckBoot state should really only be concerned with testing that the
instance has successfully booted and its API is up and ready for
ConfigureInstance's config push.  This is handled entirely by update_state()
and pushing the config here as part of the boot test is redundant, which can
be problematic in environments where a config update is an expensive task.

Change-Id: I5de24c627e468ba12fbccd3a3be713db380b645a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant config push in CheckBoot()

The CheckBoot state should really only be concerned with testing that the
instance has successfully booted and its API is up and ready for
ConfigureInstance's config push.  This is handled entirely by update_state()
and pushing the config here as part of the boot test is redundant, which can
be problematic in environments where a config update is an expensive task.

Change-Id: I5de24c627e468ba12fbccd3a3be713db380b645a

commit_message:
Fix gate issues with functional-api job

Prevents etcdctl from hanging when etcd has not started by explictly
specifying connection timeouts.
Reduce swarm build time by removing the unneccessary dependency
between masters and nodes.
Only create 1 node instead of 2 nodes
Remove test_update_bay_name_for_existing_bay

Change-Id: If6724497b47247d2858b6da90309949f92314cfb
Closes-Bug: 1541105

commit_message:
Update URLs to Django 1.8 style

django.conf.urls.patterns() is deprecated since 1.8.
We should not use patterns(), so this patch updates URLs to
1.8 style.

Closes-Bug: #1539354

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-08 20:16:23.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/api/root_controller.py', 'octavia/api/v1/controllers/__init__.py'], 'message': "Fix / and /v1 API uris

An update in the past added @staticmethod decorators to everything that didn't
use self in the function body.  Thise broke the way pecan calls the API
methods because pecan calls each method independent of the instance.  Pecan
instead passes the instance as the first argument.  With staticmethod not
having this first argument, it broke.

Change-Id: I19e30ecae3c1d49e569950b2675a73b2fbc1f942
"}]
commit_message:
Fix / and /v1 API uris

An update in the past added @staticmethod decorators to everything that didn't
use self in the function body.  Thise broke the way pecan calls the API
methods because pecan calls each method independent of the instance.  Pecan
instead passes the instance as the first argument.  With staticmethod not
having this first argument, it broke.

Change-Id: I19e30ecae3c1d49e569950b2675a73b2fbc1f942

added to the alarm history output.

This fix omits the update to alarm history if there no changes to any
alarm property.

Closes-Bug: #1465550
(cherry picked from commit e5b3988c7cb01d2230f67c41aa76935a11b0e42a in Ceilometer)

Change-Id: I42014a1d207bb32e81e8f09b65857d0608bba675
"}]
commit_message:
Update alarm history only if change in alarm property

When alarm's property is updated with the same value, an empty record is
added to the alarm history output.

This fix omits the update to alarm history if there no changes to any
alarm property.

Closes-Bug: #1465550
(cherry picked from commit e5b3988c7cb01d2230f67c41aa76935a11b0e42a in Ceilometer)

Change-Id: I42014a1d207bb32e81e8f09b65857d0608bba675

subject: Sets for index-based operations were excluded
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-20 12:49:56.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/standard_library/collections.py'], 'message': 'Sets for index-based operations were excluded

There are several operations (delete, replace etc) that define
on iterable and do something starting from specified position.
Although it is possible to iterate over set they are considered
to be unordered so it is wrong to do position-based operations
on them

Change-Id: Ia0fc2561f4dd38c5d7c2ee18cdd26e9a2074e7f7
'}]
commit_message:
Sets for index-based operations were excluded

There are several operations (delete, replace etc) that define
on iterable and do something starting from specified position.
Although it is possible to iterate over set they are considered
to be unordered so it is wrong to do position-based operations
on them

Change-Id: Ia0fc2561f4dd38c5d7c2ee18cdd26e9a2074e7f7

subject: Only evaluate RBAC filter for current request
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-08 19:19:19.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/api/v1/search.py'], 'message': 'Only evaluate RBAC filter for current request

The RBAC filter is retrieved from every plugin even if the current
request does not ask for the associated resource type.

If there is an exception thrown in doing that for a single plugin
it will block requests for any plugins.

Change-Id: I3efbf99b83068706f4266a02e00888b21464fb59
Closes-Bug: 1540696
'}]
commit_message:
Only evaluate RBAC filter for current request

The RBAC filter is retrieved from every plugin even if the current
request does not ask for the associated resource type.

If there is an exception thrown in doing that for a single plugin
it will block requests for any plugins.

Change-Id: I3efbf99b83068706f4266a02e00888b21464fb59
Closes-Bug: 1540696

commit_message:
Fixes Octavia Amphora RHEL based images

A few elements were needed to define specific repositories.

    amphora-agent: Updated and now buids with sysvinit instead
of upstart Octavia requries the use_upstart parameter to be set
to False to work with RHEL systems.
    amphora-agent-ubuntu: original element that supported upstart
    keepalived-octavia: Supports RHEL repositories

Change-Id: I961663d105ad09e7f05c77cb92efaa469f386fdc
Closes-Bug: #1531092

commit_message:
support multiple namespaces in sphinxext

Allow the directive to show multiple namespaces using two different
formats. The default is to merge all options in common groups and show
the groups in alphabetical order. The split-namespaces flag shows the
namespaces and groups in discovery order.

Change-Id: I91238a1c493cb055849821bb0273c487c20f0ecb
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
support ability to set thread pool size per listener

it'd be nice to support listeners with different threading
requirements.

e.g. 1 listener that pulls from a queue with no ordering requirements,
therefore, able to handle multiple threads. another listener that
pulls from queue with sequential requirements, therefore, requires
a single thread process all data, in order.

Change-Id: Id3af696193af2ccf5e5f3a1ae1d22f4f80860606

commit_message:
Add portgroups to support LAG interfaces - net

Ironic should be able to provide the requisite connectivity
information to the Neutron ML2 plugin to allow drivers to
provision the top-of-rack switch for the bare metal server.
The addition of portgroups in Ironic allows the concept of
link aggregation to be handled in Ironic in order to provide
support for cases where multiple interfaces on the bare metal
server connect to switch ports of a single LAG.

This commit includes changes to:
- the port vif mapping to also use portgroups

Partial-bug: #1526403
DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Jenny Moorehead (jenny.moorehead@sap.com)
Co-Authored-By: Will Stevenson (will.stevenson@sap.com)
Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko (vsaienko@mirantis.com)

Change-Id: I7f1cba65275078da750aa49ae83ba7345d6fd5e0

Routers auto scheduling works when an l3 agent starts and performs

commit_message:
Fix regression in routers auto scheduling logic

Routers auto scheduling works when an l3 agent starts and performs
a full sync with neutron server. Neutron server looks for all
unscheduled routers and schedules them to that agent if applicable.
This was broken by commit 0e97feb0f30bc0ef6f4fe041cb41b7aa81042263
which changed full sync logic a bit: now l3 agent requests all ids
of routers scheduled to it first. get_router_ids() didn't call
routers auto scheduling which caused the regression.
This patch adds routers auto scheduling to get_router_ids().

Closes-Bug: #1541348
Change-Id: If6d4e7b3a4839c93296985e169631e5583d9fa12

subject: Don't trace DB errors when we're retrying
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-04 03:23:25.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/api.py', 'oslo_db/tests/test_api.py'], 'message': "Don't trace DB errors when we're retrying

This is a two-part change that is squashed for stable, as the original
commit to master introduced undesirable behaviour of logging an
unexpected exception before re-raising it.

---

Don't trace DB errors when we're retrying

If we know we're retrying on DB failures, let's be smarter and not trace
an exception at ERROR level while looping, since this clutters up the
logs and causes confusion when trying to track down failures.

DBDeadlock errors show up quite a bit in q-svc and n-api logs in gate
runs but when you check logstash for those, they are primarily in jobs
that are successful, so the trace is on the first try in the loop and
then we pass on the second try - but the trace itself is confusing while
debugging gate failures.

So let's just be smarter and log at debug level between retries, and if
we hit an unexpected exception, log that error (as before), and raise it
up to the caller.

Closes-Bug: #1523990

Change-Id: I15b4a9b5c7ec9bfede9ec9989de02c1da46eac81
(cherry picked from commit 838e314a21fef9ca6cf99140b2400e0d3b68b109)

*** This is the 2nd commit message:

Don't log non-db error in retry wrapper

838e314a21fef9ca6cf99140b2400e0d3b68b109 changed the retry wrapper
code to not log exception traces for expected errors, like when
retrying on a DBDeadlock. It did, however, log an unexpected exception
but was not checking the type, like in the case of a nova OverQuota
exception.

Since _is_exception_expected already logs at debug level an expected
DB error, like DBDeadlock, during a retry loop, we don't need to log
it again. And if the exception is unexpected, like OverQuota from nova,
then we shouldn't trace that exception in the retry loop before
reraising but instead just let the caller handle it.

Adds a unit test to make sure that nothing is logged in the unexpected
exception case during the retry loop.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: Ic3e45029378dc96ce01398d9b55f51e20ef08189
Closes-Bug: #1532880
"}]
commit_message:
Don't trace DB errors when we're retrying

This is a two-part change that is squashed for stable, as the original
commit to master introduced undesirable behaviour of logging an
unexpected exception before re-raising it.

---

Don't trace DB errors when we're retrying

If we know we're retrying on DB failures, let's be smarter and not trace
an exception at ERROR level while looping, since this clutters up the
logs and causes confusion when trying to track down failures.

DBDeadlock errors show up quite a bit in q-svc and n-api logs in gate
runs but when you check logstash for those, they are primarily in jobs
that are successful, so the trace is on the first try in the loop and
then we pass on the second try - but the trace itself is confusing while
debugging gate failures.

So let's just be smarter and log at debug level between retries, and if
we hit an unexpected exception, log that error (as before), and raise it
up to the caller.

Closes-Bug: #1523990

Change-Id: I15b4a9b5c7ec9bfede9ec9989de02c1da46eac81
(cherry picked from commit 838e314a21fef9ca6cf99140b2400e0d3b68b109)

*** This is the 2nd commit message:

Don't log non-db error in retry wrapper

838e314a21fef9ca6cf99140b2400e0d3b68b109 changed the retry wrapper
code to not log exception traces for expected errors, like when
retrying on a DBDeadlock. It did, however, log an unexpected exception
but was not checking the type, like in the case of a nova OverQuota
exception.

Since _is_exception_expected already logs at debug level an expected
DB error, like DBDeadlock, during a retry loop, we don't need to log
it again. And if the exception is unexpected, like OverQuota from nova,
then we shouldn't trace that exception in the retry loop before
reraising but instead just let the caller handle it.

Adds a unit test to make sure that nothing is logged in the unexpected
exception case during the retry loop.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: Ic3e45029378dc96ce01398d9b55f51e20ef08189
Closes-Bug: #1532880

subject: Remove dead code around certificate handling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 18:46:08.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/certificates/generator/barbican.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/certificates/generator/test_barbican.py', 'octavia/certificates/manager/local.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/certificates/manager/test_local.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Remove dead code around certificate handling

LocalCertManager is unusable because there's no way to get cert data
into the system (the API doesn't accept it) so there's no way we could
store it, which makes it unusable for its original purpose which was to
be a dev tool (it is not suitable for production use in any case).

Barbican does not support certificate generation in a way that makes
sense for us (they do async only) and Anchor will be the way forward.
This driver will never be completed and therefore should be removed.

Change-Id: I78019bc7ad7dffc745055216ed2aace725c58de2
"}]
commit_message:
Remove dead code around certificate handling

LocalCertManager is unusable because there's no way to get cert data
into the system (the API doesn't accept it) so there's no way we could
store it, which makes it unusable for its original purpose which was to
be a dev tool (it is not suitable for production use in any case).

Barbican does not support certificate generation in a way that makes
sense for us (they do async only) and Anchor will be the way forward.
This driver will never be completed and therefore should be removed.

Change-Id: I78019bc7ad7dffc745055216ed2aace725c58de2

commit_message:
Adding a barbican-manage command

This blueprint discuss and defines a new admin command called
"barbican-manage" which interacts with Barbican service for all
management operations. The initial implementation will consolidate
several existing admin commands into it.

Change-Id: I8a69b9ed4035a1a1ff9240d1124cdc7363376ed0

commit_message:
SIGUSR1 is deprecated in Guru mediation

Guru mediation now registers SIGUSR1 and SIGUSR2 by default for
backward compatibility. SIGUSR1 will no longer be registered in
a future release, so please use SIGUSR2 to generate reports[1].

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.reports/usage.html

Change-Id: I2bd1956abfe6a94dc4135ba9810eb55e0acc6e74
Closes-Bug: #1528758

commit_message:
Show human readable size and units

In the container table view, memory size is shown like "64m".
The view format is not suitable for UI.
This patch revises size and unit to such as "64 MB".

Also, in Baymodel detail view, Docker Volume Size is shown
in suitable for UI. But Horizon's filter is not used.
So, this patch changes to be used Horizon's "bg" filter.

Change-Id: I4e8b30bebdd61ae7154b6f813528653abb4108aa
Closes-Bug: #1543013

subject: Avoid costly lazy-loads in compute manager during instance builds
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6450, 'name': 'Hans Lindgren', 'email': 'hanlind@kth.se', 'username': 'hanlind'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16897, 'name': 'Virtuozzo Storage CI', 'email': 'vzstorage-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'vzstorage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-15 07:43:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/cells/scheduler.py'], 'message': "Avoid costly lazy-loads in compute manager during instance builds

Right now every instance build attempt results in lazy-loads happening
in compute manager on first access of three different instance fields
(ec2_ids, pci_devices and vcpu_model). Doing them in compute manager
where db access results in rpc round-trips to conductor can be avoided
if doing them up-front on the controller node instead.

What's even better is that two of the mentioned fields (pci_devices and
vcpu_model) don't need db accesses at all if provided with some base
values as these lazy-loads happen before values are even populated in
the db and as such always return empty results.

The pci_devices field is considered read-only and omitted from values
to update when saving an instance. Similarily this field need to be
omitted when creating the instance.

Change-Id: Id55fb594330092a73289f335ee5b085b1ea5f495
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid costly lazy-loads in compute manager during instance builds

Right now every instance build attempt results in lazy-loads happening
in compute manager on first access of three different instance fields
(ec2_ids, pci_devices and vcpu_model). Doing them in compute manager
where db access results in rpc round-trips to conductor can be avoided
if doing them up-front on the controller node instead.

What's even better is that two of the mentioned fields (pci_devices and
vcpu_model) don't need db accesses at all if provided with some base
values as these lazy-loads happen before values are even populated in
the db and as such always return empty results.

The pci_devices field is considered read-only and omitted from values
to update when saving an instance. Similarily this field need to be
omitted when creating the instance.

Change-Id: Id55fb594330092a73289f335ee5b085b1ea5f495

This test is for verifying functionality of rebuilding instance with volume.
The following is the scenario outline:

4. Create a file with timestamp on the volume
5. Rebuild the instance

7. Detach the volume

commit_message:
Add new test "RebuildInstanceWithVolume"

This test is for verifying functionality of rebuilding instance with volume.
The following is the scenario outline:
1. Boot an instance
2. Create a volume
3. Attach the volume to the instance
4. Create a file with timestamp on the volume
5. Rebuild the instance
6. Check existence of the file which was created at step #4
7. Detach the volume

Co-Authored-By: Roman Podoliaka <rpodolyaka@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Adding ability to unset fields with update calls

Adding a sentinel object that will be used as a default
value in update methods. This object will allow to
distinguish whether a field should be unset or should
not be updated.

Change-Id: Ie6679c8f64623e8570176b8009380b08de2be6a5
Closes-bug: #1534050

commit_message:
Add network availability zone support

Add support for network availability zones per [1]. See [2]
for availability zone documentation in the networking guide.

This support enables a network to be scheduled to the
applicable DHCP agent(s) based on the availability zone hint(s)
set for the network.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169612/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258367/

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-availability-zone
Closes-Bug: #1539274
Change-Id: Iaf3d02d526ce38c51aac0178350c65927e451ab5

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-05 21:59:04.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/tests/tests.py', 'openstack_auth/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix "Add API version to identity endpoint URLs"

Change Ieff5a6cdd1ad352a9731d46785802e8c36adcdd1 introduced an
uncomplete fix when trying to fix the auth_url.
Given the case that a auth url already has a version included, an extra
version was added. This leads to messages in the keystone.log that
horizon is trying to authenticate with "POST /v3/v3/auth/tokens
HTTP/1.1".
Use urlparse correctly and also add a testcase for fix_auth_url_version().

Change-Id: I80fb310d95e8fdab1212fc5b092a37fd7b26a37a
Closes-Bug: 1508421
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "Add API version to identity endpoint URLs"

Change Ieff5a6cdd1ad352a9731d46785802e8c36adcdd1 introduced an
uncomplete fix when trying to fix the auth_url.
Given the case that a auth url already has a version included, an extra
version was added. This leads to messages in the keystone.log that
horizon is trying to authenticate with "POST /v3/v3/auth/tokens
HTTP/1.1".
Use urlparse correctly and also add a testcase for fix_auth_url_version().

Change-Id: I80fb310d95e8fdab1212fc5b092a37fd7b26a37a
Closes-Bug: 1508421

commit_message:
Split the Rados GW tests into parts

This is a afirst step to refactor and fix the acceptance tests.
The goal is to first break it into smaller chunks for easier debugging,
then move to infernalis and liberty and finally fix and reenable CentOS
tests.

tools/tox_install.sh exists to deal with installing neutron without

The way this operates causes problems in the periodic jobs on the stable

commit_message:
Add an explicit BRANCH_NAME to tox_install.sh

tools/tox_install.sh exists to deal with installing neutron without
neutron existing as a pypi package.

The way this operates causes problems in the periodic jobs on the stable
branches.  Make it explicit which branch to install in the gate
(zuul-cloner) and via pip.

This is done with a BRANCH_NAME variable to make it trivial to change
once "master" is tagged as stable.

Change-Id: I6a5b63fa82a6a7480adadd2f65463619fd077f7f

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-02-05 18:13:02.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/plugins.rst', 'searchlight/tests/functional/test_listener.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_designate_zone_plugin.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/base.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/designate/notification_handlers.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/servers_notification_handler.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_indexing_helper.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/utils.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/__init__.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_plugin.py', 'searchlight/tests/fake_plugins.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/test_load.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/v1/test_search.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/glance/images_notification_handler.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/servers.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/glance/metadefs_notification_handler.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_designate_recordset_plugin.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_glance_image_plugin.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/__init__.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/test_api.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_glance_metadefs_plugin.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_nova_server_plugin.py', 'searchlight/context.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/test_glance_plugins.py', 'searchlight/api/v1/search.py'], 'message': "Separate documents by role

See spec:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/searchlight-specs/specs/mitaka/search-admin-only-fields.html

This patch adds a field __searchlight-user-role to every document
indexed. On a per document basis (by default, dependent on whether there
are any admin-only fields), documents are indexed either once (with this
field set to ['admin', 'user'] or twice (for each of those values) where
the 'user' document has admin-only fields removed. Ids are suffixed with
'_ADMIN' or '_USER' in this case.

Reindexing is required.

A helper class has been added to bridge the uncomfortable gap between
the notification handler and indexing-specific aspects of plugins.

'unsearchable fields' is removed (though perhaps should be deprecated);
'admin only fields' remains (as was the original pre-liberty intent). By
default, the presence of admin only fields determines whether a plugin
requires role-based separation but this can be overridden.

Searching adds a query filter based on the request_context to ALL
searches (even admin ones).

It should also be noted in the release notes that accessing document by
id in elasticsearch is no longer directly possible; a role suffix is
*sometimes* required (but not always). Searchlight should be used to
retrieve documents.

Change-Id: I36b46ff3b1d0cdb031866f54e9ae54326349c441
Implements: blueprint index-level-role-separation
"}]
commit_message:
Separate documents by role

See spec:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/searchlight-specs/specs/mitaka/search-admin-only-fields.html

This patch adds a field __searchlight-user-role to every document
indexed. On a per document basis (by default, dependent on whether there
are any admin-only fields), documents are indexed either once (with this
field set to ['admin', 'user'] or twice (for each of those values) where
the 'user' document has admin-only fields removed. Ids are suffixed with
'_ADMIN' or '_USER' in this case.

Reindexing is required.

A helper class has been added to bridge the uncomfortable gap between
the notification handler and indexing-specific aspects of plugins.

'unsearchable fields' is removed (though perhaps should be deprecated);
'admin only fields' remains (as was the original pre-liberty intent). By
default, the presence of admin only fields determines whether a plugin
requires role-based separation but this can be overridden.

Searching adds a query filter based on the request_context to ALL
searches (even admin ones).

It should also be noted in the release notes that accessing document by
id in elasticsearch is no longer directly possible; a role suffix is
*sometimes* required (but not always). Searchlight should be used to
retrieve documents.

Change-Id: I36b46ff3b1d0cdb031866f54e9ae54326349c441
Implements: blueprint index-level-role-separation

commit_message:
Increase devstack timeout

Increase devstack wrapper timeout by 5 mins since devstack-gate will use
10 mins - instead of the previous 5 mins - as buffer.

This is needed in this form only for those jobs changed by
21837612a5f79861f20487307b763e1902cfd1cd.

Change-Id: Ida6e84f6c9458d46b7c3792bf57eff27dd72b258
Needed-By: Iea866e4cc40e149e598f35e010ec855937bdf9ae

commit_message:
Remove DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT [part 4]

With change Iff5e96bd80b8f165ccc7d6be09b53208613571eb, we do not need
to pass DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT anymore to devstack-gate, instead the
value from the build-timeout wrapper is passed.

Remove DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT for jenkins/jobs/[n-z]*.yaml

Increase timeout for all non-grenade jobs by 5 mins since
Iea866e4cc40e149e598f35e010ec855937bdf9ae will use a 10 minute buffer
and the internal timeout should stay the same. The grenade jobs already
have 10 mins of buffer, so no need adjust the timeout.

Adjust timeout for gate-rally-dsvm-cue-{broker},
the removed variable in builder devstack-cue-rally-gate was 100,
so set timeout to 110.

Change-Id: I623fff029fb2e0acdbe2bf93a13af02547062a71

commit_message:
Convert unittest-app bash script to python

1. Added timeout for running user's arbitrary unittest script;
2. Limit memory usage of a container in which user's unittest
script runs.

Partially-fixes-bug: #1302552
Change-Id: Ibd0fe3b09295839e7f8279cddabb56442c1d87c8

commit_message:
Add update_access() method to driver interface

- Add update_access() method to driver interface
- Move all code related to access operations to ShareInstanceAccess
class
- Statuses from individual access rules are now mapped to
share_instance's access_rules_status
- Add 'access_rules_status' field to share instance, which indicates
current status of applying access rules

APIImpact
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Barbieri <rodrigo.barbieri@fit-tecnologia.org.br>
Co-Authored-By: Tiago Pasqualini da Silva <tiago.pasqualini@gmail.com>
Implements: bp new-share-access-driver-interface

Change-Id: Iff1ec2e3176a46e9f6bd383b38ffc5d838aa8bb8

commit_message:
Add missing semicolon in run-tox.sh

The find invocation in run-tox.sh needs a terminating ";" (oops!),
not just a "\" at the end.

Change-Id: Ib39ed79d9c0e81bb2800b1965fcc2b06e5aa5dfe

Now any Python class or object can be yaqlified

Change-Id: I8973492aa6a86d119b05fd33dd8b00ce283fee98
'}]
commit_message:
Ability to yaqlize any Python class was added

Now any Python class or object can be yaqlified
with single function call or decorator.

It is possible to call methods, access attributes/properties
and index yaqlified objects. It is possible to disable any
of these 3 operations and specify whitelist/blacklist
of methods/attributes/keys that are exposed to the
yaql.

Change-Id: I8973492aa6a86d119b05fd33dd8b00ce283fee98

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-05 03:45:14.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Add ndg-httpsclient to global requirements

This package is recommended for secure operations by:
http://urllib3.readthedocs.org/en/latest/security.html

It has a BSD license and supports both Py2 and Py3.
It is part of urllib3[secure] and requests[secure].

We would like to import this in the Octavia project so 'requests' can
properly verify HTTPS requests and validate client/server certs.

Change-Id: Id233df6061da47bd28f543615b6bf2a75e29a6cb
"}]
commit_message:
Add ndg-httpsclient to global requirements

This package is recommended for secure operations by:
http://urllib3.readthedocs.org/en/latest/security.html

It has a BSD license and supports both Py2 and Py3.
It is part of urllib3[secure] and requests[secure].

We would like to import this in the Octavia project so 'requests' can
properly verify HTTPS requests and validate client/server certs.

Change-Id: Id233df6061da47bd28f543615b6bf2a75e29a6cb

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-08 10:01:57.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/swift/proxy.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/swift/swift_spec.rb'], 'message': "Add a new swift_backups section in rsync conf

On primary controller we are executing all stuff (like ring create, rebalance and etc).
Swift Ring Builder requires folder '/etc/swift/backups' with proper permissions (2770).

On another controllers, we just run rsync from primary, for '/etc/swift/backups' directory.
The problem is that we are using settings from swift_server section (which comes from
swift upstream module). This section has default incoming_chmod/outgoing_chmod = '0644'.
Hense all another controllers have these permissions for '/etc/swift/backups'.
In case, when we want to destroy old primary + add new controller - we faced with wrong
permissions for '/etc/swift/backups' on all controller nodes.

Change-Id: I47ee344e6ea6d65eb984941287ec9c0ed3e28a5b
Related-bug: #1518305
Closes-bug: #1542281
"}]
commit_message:
Add a new swift_backups section in rsync conf

On primary controller we are executing all stuff (like ring create, rebalance and etc).
Swift Ring Builder requires folder '/etc/swift/backups' with proper permissions (2770).

On another controllers, we just run rsync from primary, for '/etc/swift/backups' directory.
The problem is that we are using settings from swift_server section (which comes from
swift upstream module). This section has default incoming_chmod/outgoing_chmod = '0644'.
Hense all another controllers have these permissions for '/etc/swift/backups'.
In case, when we want to destroy old primary + add new controller - we faced with wrong
permissions for '/etc/swift/backups' on all controller nodes.

Change-Id: I47ee344e6ea6d65eb984941287ec9c0ed3e28a5b
Related-bug: #1518305
Closes-bug: #1542281

commit_message:

Now that the keystone v2 job runs against stable liberty, we have
to look in a different location for the clouds.yaml file since it

commit_message:
Hyper-V: adds os-win library

Adds os-win to requirements.txt.
Replaces the current usage of *Utils classes in the
Hyper-V Driver with the equivalent *Utils classes
from os-win.

Adds decorators to the HyperVDriver methods that prevent
os-win specific exceptions to leak outside the driver.

Depends-On: Id5cd1dce195b38611f4f8c74857087620048b13f

Co-Authored-By: Lucian Petrut <lpetrut@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially Implements: blueprint add-os-win-library

Change-Id: I04509843210dcedf98a0cd9e08fa07865c8a76de

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 15:48:43.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Enable voting for Puppet OpenStack Integration jobs"

We're having CI issues at this time, and need to land some patches that
won't pass integration jobs.

We need to patch puppet-nova and puppet-gnocchi required to pass
integration jobs but we'll also need to patch
puppet-openstack-integration to make all them pass.
Because of this chicken & egg problem, we want to disable voting for

'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Enable voting for Puppet OpenStack Integration jobs"

We're having CI issues at this time, and need to land some patches that
won't pass integration jobs.

We need to patch puppet-nova and puppet-gnocchi required to pass
integration jobs but we'll also need to patch
puppet-openstack-integration to make all them pass.
Because of this chicken & egg problem, we want to disable voting for
today and eventually tomorrow, until we sort this out.

This reverts commit e1cee88bea0a38cb85168e009a6ebdc2aaa747b7.

Change-Id: Iab40d374d4f37350519dfc961e5f0a1b14847abf

subject: Expose extras information in requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-10-22 19:26:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_requirements/tests/test_requirement.py', 'openstack_requirements/requirement.py'], 'message': "Expose extras information in requirements

Starting with oslo.db+Nova, we would like to specify say
oslo.db[fixtures] in Nova's test-requirements. If you see
the proposed review I4131e534d4cb12e4888d398fa4fb7c922e369210
the gate-nova-requirements fails because code in
project-config/jenkins/scripts/project-requirements-change.py
does not understand extras at all and treats both oslo.db
and oslo.db[fixtures] the same. Since that module
uses requirement.py, we should expose the information here
first and then fix project-config after that.

Change-Id: I146baa3ef94cc8bbf29af371786f3ea95a42cb9f
"}]
commit_message:
Expose extras information in requirements

Starting with oslo.db+Nova, we would like to specify say
oslo.db[fixtures] in Nova's test-requirements. If you see
the proposed review I4131e534d4cb12e4888d398fa4fb7c922e369210
the gate-nova-requirements fails because code in
project-config/jenkins/scripts/project-requirements-change.py
does not understand extras at all and treats both oslo.db
and oslo.db[fixtures] the same. Since that module
uses requirement.py, we should expose the information here
first and then fix project-config after that.

Change-Id: I146baa3ef94cc8bbf29af371786f3ea95a42cb9f

commit_message:
Handle exception when worker unlocks already unlocked resource

The same exception is handled similary elsewhere.  This avoids a corner
case where the worker ends up throwing an exception here and blocking
the state machine from processing future messages.

(backported to liberty from 6cf7784f51f92c82a46f25f8da63e92403a37ca2)

Change-Id: I14709faac9228797f9ca043e45c550449437e561
Closes-bug: #1536901
(cherry picked from commit e980378e68c5a43a63fbabe41383c22aa3f65678)

subject: Ignore --config-dir when value is None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 07:08:50.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_privsep/daemon.py', 'oslo_privsep/tests/test_daemon.py'], 'message': 'Ignore --config-dir when value is None

Previous code incorrectly used an explicit --config-dir=None on the
privsep-helper command line when cfg.CONF.config_dir was None (the
default).  This change correctly skips the --config-dir flag entirely in
this situation.

Change-Id: I8d71b1e0c5ab702a39c3e56119611700a126a5d4
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore --config-dir when value is None

Previous code incorrectly used an explicit --config-dir=None on the
privsep-helper command line when cfg.CONF.config_dir was None (the
default).  This change correctly skips the --config-dir flag entirely in
this situation.

Change-Id: I8d71b1e0c5ab702a39c3e56119611700a126a5d4
